analyzed: phra rgyas kyi dmigs pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /

original: ldan par 'gyur ba'i dngos po dang ldan par mi 'gyur ba'i dngos po'o //
analyzed: ldan par 'gyur ba'i dngos po dang ldan par mi 'gyur ba'i dngos po'o //
translated: the object-field that is the possession of the person, and the object-field that is not the possession of the person.

original: de la gang zag gi rgyud la ldan par 'gyur ba'i dngos po'i yul can rnams dang / de'i yul can ma yin pa'i phra rgyas de dag gi stobs kyis bskyed pa rnams kyi thob pa nyon mongs pa ma 'ongs pa dang 'das pa'i rgyu dang 'bras bur gyur pa ni gang zag gi rgyud nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i sems la yang rgyun miüîΩ'chad par rab tu 'byung la /
analyzed: de la gang zag gi rgyud la ldan par 'gyur ba'i dngos po'i yul can rnams dang / de'i yul can ma yin pa'i phra rgyas de dag gi stobs kyis bskyed pa rnams kyi thob pa nyon mongs pa ma 'ongs pa dang 'das pa'i rgyu dang 'bras bur gyur pa ni gang zag gi rgyud nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i sems la yang rgyun mi 'chad par rab tu 'byung la /
translated: The obtainment of those that possess objects that are things that exist in the mindstream of a person and those that are not their objects but are generated by the power of those negative tendencies is the cause and result of future and past affliction and it arises uninterruptedly in the mindstream of a person even when the mind is unafflicted.

original: ldan par mi 'gyur ba'i dngos po'i yul can rnams dang / de'i yul can ma yin pa de'i yul can gyi nyon mongs pa dag gi rjes la kun du 'byung ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams kyi thob pa yang de dang 'dra bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: ldan par mi 'gyur ba'i dngos po'i yul can rnams dang / de'i yul can ma yin pa de'i yul can gyi nyon mongs pa dag gi rjes la kun du 'byung ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams kyi thob pa yang de dang 'dra bar rig par bya'o //
translated: The obtainment of those that do not possess objects that are things and those that are not their objects but arise subsequent to the affliction that possesses their object should be understood in the same way.

original: de ni ma 'ongs pa rnams skye ba'i rkyen du 'gyur ba'i phyir rgyur gyur ba yang yin la 'das pa rnams kyi rgyu mthun par 'gyur ba'i phyir 'bras bur gyur ba yang yin no //
analyzed: de ni ma 'ongs pa rnams skye ba'i rkyen du 'gyur ba'i phyir rgyur gyur ba yang yin la 'das pa rnams kyi rgyu mthun par 'gyur ba'i phyir 'bras bur gyur ba yang yin no //
translated: It is a cause because it is the condition for the generation of future defilements, and it is a result because it is the natural outcome of past defilements.

original: nyon mongs pa rnams ni des kun du gzung ba'i phyir de yang spong ba gnyen po rgyu mthun pa thob pa dang ; phrad par 'gal lo //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa rnams ni des kun du gzung ba'i phyir de yang spong ba gnyen po rgyu mthun pa thob pa dang ; phrad par 'gal lo //
translated: The defilements are not abandoned by the obtainment of the antidote, because the obtainment of the antidote and the possession of the defilements are mutually incompatible.

original: de'i phyir dmigs pa gang zhig gis skyes pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams ni gzhan la dmigs pa'i nyon mongs pa dag kyang rab tu 'byung bar byed la de la dmigs pa spong ba gnyen po'i rgyu mthun pa skyes na nyon mongs pa de dag de la dmigs pa
analyzed: de'i phyir dmigs pa gang zhig gis skyes pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams ni gzhan la dmigs pa'i nyon mongs pa dag kyang rab tu 'byung bar byed la de la dmigs pa spong ba gnyen po'i rgyu mthun pa skyes na nyon mongs pa de dag de la dmigs pa
translated: Therefore, the defilements that arise in regard to a certain object also occur in regard to other objects. When the obtainment of the antidote that is the abandonment of the object occurs, the obtainment of those defilements is destroyed even though the object exists.

original: yin yang rgyu dang 'bras bu dang bral na de dag gi thob pa bcom pa la spangs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yin yang rgyu dang 'bras bu dang bral na de dag gi thob pa bcom pa la spangs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called abandonment.

original: de bas na gang gi phyir nyon mongs pa'i yul 'ga' zhig gi dngos po ji lta ba bzhin yongs su ma shes na rgyud la de'i yul can gyi nyon mongs pa'i stobs kyis de'i yul can ma yin pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams kyi thob pa @141a * //üîΩma 'ongs pa dang / 'das pa'i rgyu dang 'bras bur gyur pa dngos po ji lta ba bzhin ma yin par rab tu 'byung ba de'i phyir dmigs pa las nyon mongs pa spang bar bya ba yin no zhes bya bar 'dod do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de bas na gang gi phyir nyon mongs pa'i yul 'ga' zhig gi dngos po ji lta ba bzhin yongs su ma shes na rgyud la de'i yul can gyi nyon mongs pa'i stobs kyis de'i yul can ma yin pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams kyi thob pa @141a * // ma 'ongs pa dang / 'das pa'i rgyu dang 'bras bur gyur pa dngos po ji lta ba bzhin ma yin par rab tu 'byung ba de'i phyir dmigs pa las nyon mongs pa spang bar bya ba yin no zhes bya bar 'dod do zhes zer ro //
translated: Therefore, if one does not fully understand the object of affliction, the obtainment of other afflictions that are not its object will arise in the future due to the power of the affliction that is its object.üîΩSince the object of affliction is not fully understood, the cause and effect of the past and future arise in a manner that is not in accordance with reality. Therefore it is asserted that afflictions are to be abandoned in dependence on their focal object.

original: de la dmigs pa spangs pa la sogs pas kyang nyon mongs pa spang bar 'gyur ro zhes bya bar 'dod pa ma yin nam ci ste dmigs pa yongs su shes pa'i stobs kyis nyon mongs pa rnams spang bar 'gyur zhes bya ba 'di smras she na /
analyzed: de la dmigs pa spangs pa la sogs pas kyang nyon mongs pa spang bar 'gyur ro zhes bya bar 'dod pa ma yin nam ci ste dmigs pa yongs su shes pa'i stobs kyis nyon mongs pa rnams spang bar 'gyur zhes bya ba 'di smras she na /
translated: Isn't it asserted that afflictions are abandoned by abandoning their focal object and so on? Why is it said that afflictions are abandoned by the power of comprehending their focal object?

original: bsam pa ni de dag kyang sdug bsngal la sogs pa yongs su shes pa'i stobs kho nas spang bar 'gyur te //
analyzed: bsam pa ni de dag kyang sdug bsngal la sogs pa yongs su shes pa'i stobs kho nas spang bar 'gyur te //

original: de yod pa'i ngo bo dang ldan pas de yod pa'i ngo bo dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //üîΩgang dag gnyen po skyes pas spong bar brjod pa bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa de dag kyang dmigs pa sdug bsngal gyi bden pa la sogs pa yongs su shes pa kho nas spang bar 'gyur ro zhes bya bar khong du chud par bya'o //

original: de la dmigs pas spangs pa la sogs pas kyang nyon mongs pa rnams spang bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba gang yin pa de ni rnam par gzhag pa tsam du zad do zhes bya ba yin par mngon no //

translated: The meaning is that the past is not by virtue of having existed a long time ago, and the future is not by virtue of existing a long time from now.üîΩThe present would also be distant in the same way.

original: dper na 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i dus nyid kyis 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i dus nyid kyis 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa lta bu'o //
translated: The present would also be distant by virtue of being a different time, just as the past and future are distant by virtue of being different times.

original: 'o na ni byed pas ring ba yin no zhes bya ba ni byed pa zhig pa ni 'das pa yin la /
analyzed: 'o na ni byed pas ring ba yin no zhes bya ba ni byed pa zhig pa ni 'das pa yin la /
translated: But it is distant by virtue of its activity.

original: byed pa ma thob pa ni ma 'ongs pa yin pas 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa de ring ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: byed pa ma thob pa ni ma 'ongs pa yin pas 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa de ring ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The past is that which has ceased to exist by virtue of its activity. The future is that which has not yet attained its activity. Therefore, the past and future are said to be distant.

original: 'dus ma byas ji ltar nye ba nyid du 'grub ces bya ba ni de la byed pa med pa'i phyir nye ba nyid du mi 'gyur ba zhig na bstan bcos las chos nye ba dag gang zhe na /

translated: What are near phenomena?

original: da ltar byung ba'i chos rnams dang / 'dus ma byas so zhes 'byung ba'i phyir der yang 'dod do //
analyzed: da ltar byung ba'i chos rnams dang / 'dus ma byas so zhes 'byung ba'i phyir der yang 'dod do //
translated: They are present phenomena and unconditioned phenomena.üîΩBecause it is obtained in all objects.

original: de thams cad thob pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni 'dus ma byas so sor brtags pas 'gog pa dang so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa de'i thob pa yul thams cad du skye @142a * //üîΩba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de thams cad thob pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni 'dus ma byas so sor brtags pas 'gog pa dang so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa de'i thob pa yul thams cad du skye @142a * // ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The obtainment of unconditioned states, analytical cessations and nonanalytical cessations, arises in all objects.üîΩThe consequence is that past and future states would also be near.

original: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dag la yang thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni dge ba la sogs pa 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i thob pa yul thams cad du 'byung bas 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa nye ba nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dag la yang thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni dge ba la sogs pa 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i thob pa yul thams cad du 'byung bas 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa nye ba nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The obtainment of past and future virtuous states and so on would arise in all objects. Therefore it would follow that past and future states would be near.

original: nam mkha' yang ji ltar nye ba yin zhes bya ba ni nam mkha' yang ji ltar nye ba yin te /
analyzed: nam mkha' yang ji ltar nye ba yin zhes bya ba ni nam mkha' yang ji ltar nye ba yin te /
translated: How could space be near?

original: de la ni thob pa med do //
analyzed: de la ni thob pa med do //
translated: Space is not obtained.üîΩThe past and future are distant from each other.

original: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i phan tshun ring ba yin zhes bya ba ni ma 'ongs pa yang 'das pa las ring la 'das pa yang ma 'ongs pa las ring ngo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i phan tshun ring ba yin zhes bya ba ni ma 'ongs pa yang 'das pa las ring la 'das pa yang ma 'ongs pa las ring ngo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The past is distant from the future and the future is distant from the past.üîΩUnconditioned states are not distant because they are not obstructed.

analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas nyon mongs pa rnams mthong bas spang bar bya ba dang / bsgom pas spang bar bya ba yin no zhes rgyas par bshad pa bden pa mthong ba ni mthong ba'i lam gyis yin la /
translated: Thus it extensively explains that afflictions are objects to be abandoned by the path of seeing and objects to be abandoned by the path of meditation. Seeing the truths is by the path of seeing.

original: bden pa bsgom pa ni bsgom pa'i lam gyis yin pas de'i phyir da ni mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i lam de dag ci zag pa med pa'am zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'di brjod do /
analyzed: bden pa bsgom pa ni bsgom pa'i lam gyis yin pas de'i phyir da ni mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i lam de dag ci zag pa med pa'am zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'di brjod do /
translated: The cultivation of the truths is by the path of cultivation. Therefore, now this is stated: ‚ÄúAre those paths of seeing and cultivation uncontaminated or contaminated?‚Äù

original: de lam bstan pa nye bar dgod pa la zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: de lam bstan pa nye bar dgod pa la zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: This is applied to ‚Äúthe teaching of the path is set forth.‚Äù

original: khams gsum pa'i gnyen po yin @150b pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni mthong ba'i lam 'jig rten pa nyid cig yin na srid pa'i rtse mo'i gnyen por mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: khams gsum pa'i gnyen po yin @150b pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni mthong ba'i lam 'jig rten pa nyid cig yin na srid pa'i rtse mo'i gnyen por mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Because it is the antidote to the three realms means that if the path of seeing were mundane, it would not become the antidote to the summit of existence.

original: gzhan yang mthong bas spang bar bya ba rnam pa dgu cig car du spong ba'i phyir bsgom pa'i lam bzhin du 'jig rten pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan yang mthong bas spang bar bya ba rnam pa dgu cig car du spong ba'i phyir bsgom pa'i lam bzhin du 'jig rten pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Moreover, because it simultaneously abandons the nine aspects of objects to be abandoned by the path of seeing, it is not like the mundane path of cultivation.

original: 'jig rten pa la ni khams gsum pa spong ba dang rnam pa dgu cig car du spong ba de 'dra ba'i mthu med do //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa la ni khams gsum pa spong ba dang rnam pa dgu cig car du spong ba de 'dra ba'i mthu med do //
translated: Mundane beings do not have the power to abandon the three realms and simultaneously abandon the nine aspects.

original: gal te 'jig rten las 'das pa rnam pa dgu cig car du spong ba'i mthu zhig yod na bsgom pas spang bar bya ba rnams kyang 'jig rten las 'das pas cig car spong bar thal bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te 'jig rten las 'das pa rnam pa dgu cig car du spong ba'i mthu zhig yod na bsgom pas spang bar bya ba rnams kyang 'jig rten las 'das pas cig car spong bar thal bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If there were the power to simultaneously abandon the nine aspects of the mundane, then it would follow that objects to be abandoned by the path of meditation would also be simultaneously abandoned by the supramundane path.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa kho nas cig car spong ngo zhes bya bar nges par gzung gi /'jig rten las 'das pas cig car du spong ba kho na yin no zhes bya bar ni ma yin pas der thal bar ni mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa kho nas cig car spong ngo zhes bya bar nges par gzung gi /'jig rten las 'das pas cig car du spong ba kho na yin no zhes bya bar ni ma yin pas der thal bar ni mi 'gyur ro //
translated: It is certain that the supramundane path alone simultaneously abandons them, but it is not certain that they are simultaneously abandoned by the supramundane path alone, so this is not a logical consequence.

original: bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams ni gzhi dang bcas pa yin pa'i phyir bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams ni gzhi dang bcas pa yin pa'i phyir bstan pa yin te /
translated: Objects to be abandoned by the path of meditation are taught to have a basis,

original: de'i phyir de dag ni 'jig rten las 'das pas kyang cig car du mi spong ngo //
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag ni 'jig rten las 'das pas kyang cig car du mi spong ngo //
translated: and therefore they are not simultaneously abandoned by the supramundane path.üîΩIf that were not so,

original: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba ni gal te ji ltar mngon par rtogs pa bzhin bstan par bzhed pa ma yin pa zhig tu gyur na /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba ni gal te ji ltar mngon par rtogs pa bzhin bstan par bzhed pa ma yin pa zhig tu gyur na /
translated: if it were not asserted that they are taught in accordance with realization,

original: 'jig rten na rgyu rnams snga bar mthong ba'i phyir rgyu ni sngar bstan te /
analyzed: 'jig rten na rgyu rnams snga bar mthong ba'i phyir rgyu ni sngar bstan te /
translated: The cause is taught first because in the world, causes are seen to precede their results.

original: kun 'byung ba'i bden pa sngar bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: kun 'byung ba'i bden pa sngar bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus the truth of origination is taught first.

original: dper na dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang / bsam gtan la sogs pa lta bu'o zhes bya ba ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa skye ba dang mthun par bstan pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: dper na dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang / bsam gtan la sogs pa lta bu'o zhes bya ba ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa skye ba dang mthun par bstan pa lta bu ste /
translated: For example, like the applications of mindfulness, the meditative absorptions, etc.

original: lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa ni ji ltar rags pa bzhin dmigs pa'i sgo nas te /
analyzed: lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa ni ji ltar rags pa bzhin dmigs pa'i sgo nas te /
translated: The application of the mindfulness of the body is taught first because it is the coarsest object.

original: rgyu ba phra ba dang rags pa'i sgo nas sam /
analyzed: rgyu ba phra ba dang rags pa'i sgo nas sam /
translated: Or, it is taught first because the movement of the body is the coarsest,üîΩand the movement of the mind is the subtlest.üîΩOr, it is taught first because the body is the cause of the mind and the mind is the result of the body.

original: snga ma dang phyi ma rgyu dang 'bras bur gyur pa'i sgo nas sngar skyes la de'i 'og tu tshor ba dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: snga ma dang phyi ma rgyu dang 'bras bur gyur pa'i sgo nas sngar skyes la de'i 'og tu tshor ba dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'o //

original: de'i 'og tu sems dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu sems dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'o //
translated: The application of the mindfulness of mind is taught after that.

original: de'i 'og tu chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'o //
translated: The application of the mindfulness of phenomena is taught after that.

original: de ltar na 'di dag ni skye ba dang mthun par bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: de ltar na 'di dag ni skye ba dang mthun par bstan pa yin te /
translated: Thus, they are taught in accordance with their arising.

original: bsam gtan la sogs pa yang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan la sogs pa yang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: The same applies to the meditative development of the superknowledges and so on.

original: stsogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni rnam par thar pa dang / zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched dang / zad par gyi skye mched la sogs pa yang skye ba dang mthun par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: stsogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni rnam par thar pa dang / zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched dang / zad par gyi skye mched la sogs pa yang skye ba dang mthun par bstan pa yin no //
translated: The words 'and so on' are stated in order to include the meditative development of the emancipations, the spheres of mastery, the spheres of totality and so on.

original: kha cig ni rab tu brtags pa dang mthun par bstan zhes bya ba ni rab tu @151a * //
analyzed: kha cig ni rab tu brtags pa dang mthun par bstan zhes bya ba ni rab tu @151a * //
translated: Some are taught in accordance with the investigation.

original: brtags pa dang mthun par te /
analyzed: brtags pa dang mthun par te /
translated: In accordance with the investigation;

original: rtogs sla bar bstan zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rtogs sla bar bstan zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: that is to say, they are taught in such a way that they are easily understood.üîΩFor example, the correct exertions;

original: dper na yang dag par spong ba rnams lta bu ste zhes bya ba ni dkar po dang nag po'i phyogs dag la so sor skyes pa dang ma skyes pa'i bye brag gi sgo nas bstan pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: dper na yang dag par spong ba rnams lta bu ste zhes bya ba ni dkar po dang nag po'i phyogs dag la so sor skyes pa dang ma skyes pa'i bye brag gi sgo nas bstan pa lta bu ste /
translated: the correct exertions are taught in terms of the individual distinctions between what has and has not arisen in regard to the bright and dark sides.

original: skyes pa ni 'dul ba'i skye bos skyes pa rtogs par sla'i ma skyes pa ni ma yin pa'am /
analyzed: skyes pa ni 'dul ba'i skye bos skyes pa rtogs par sla'i ma skyes pa ni ma yin pa'am /
translated: What has arisen is easily understood by those who are trained in the investigation of what has arisen, not what has not arisen.

original: nag po'i phyogs rtogs par sla bas so //
analyzed: nag po'i phyogs rtogs par sla bas so //
translated: Or else, the dark side is easily understood.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos skyes pa rnams spangs pa'i phyir 'dun pa bskyed do //üîΩbrtson 'grus rtsom mo //
analyzed: sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos skyes pa rnams spangs pa'i phyir 'dun pa bskyed do // brtson 'grus rtsom mo //
translated: He generates enthusiasm for the abandonment of evil, unwholesome states that have arisen.üîΩHe makes an effort, exerts his mind, and strives.üîΩ

original: sems rab tu 'dzin to //üîΩyang dag par rab tu 'jog go //üîΩma skyes pa rnams mi skyed pa'i phyir 'dun pa bskyed do zhes bya ba snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: sems rab tu 'dzin to // yang dag par rab tu 'jog go // ma skyes pa rnams mi skyed pa'i phyir 'dun pa bskyed do zhes bya ba snga ma bzhin no //
translated: He generates zeal, makes an effort, exerts his mind, and strives so that unwholesome states that have already arisen will be abandoned.üîΩHe generates zeal, makes an effort, exerts his mind, and strives so that unwholesome states that have not yet arisen will not arise.

original: dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams bskyed pa'i phyir 'dun pa bskyed do zhes bya ba snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams bskyed pa'i phyir 'dun pa bskyed do zhes bya ba snga ma bzhin no //
translated: He generates zeal, makes an effort, exerts his mind, and strives so that wholesome states that have not yet arisen will arise.

original: skyes pa rnams gnas par bya ba dang / mi brjod par bya ba dang goms par bya ba'i phyir 'dun pa bskyed do zhes bya ba snga ma bzhin no //üîΩgang sngar ni skyes pa rnams spang bar bya ba'i phyir 'dun pa bskyed la /
analyzed: skyes pa rnams gnas par bya ba dang / mi brjod par bya ba dang goms par bya ba'i phyir 'dun pa bskyed do zhes bya ba snga ma bzhin no // gang sngar ni skyes pa rnams spang bar bya ba'i phyir 'dun pa bskyed la /
translated: He generates zeal, makes an effort, exerts his mind, and strives so that wholesome states that have arisen will remain, will not disappear, will be unforgotten, will be cultivated, will increase, will expand, and will be fulfilled by development.üîΩThere is no fixed rule that one generates zeal in order to abandon unwholesome states that have already arisen,

original: phyis ni ma skyes pa rnams mi skye bar bya ba'i phyir 'dun pa bskyed pa'i nges pa 'di ni med do //
analyzed: phyis ni ma skyes pa rnams mi skye bar bya ba'i phyir 'dun pa bskyed pa'i nges pa 'di ni med do //
translated: and later generates zeal in order to prevent unwholesome states that have not yet arisen from arising.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /

original: sngar yang ma skyes pa rnams mi skyed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sngar yang ma skyes pa rnams mi skyed pa'i phyir /

original: 'dun pa bskyed la phyis kyang skyes pa rnams spang ba'i phyir 'dun pa bskyed de /
analyzed: 'dun pa bskyed la phyis kyang skyes pa rnams spang ba'i phyir 'dun pa bskyed de /
translated: And later, they generate enthusiasm to abandon those already generated.

original: dper brjod pa ni 'di yin no //
analyzed: dper brjod pa ni 'di yin no //
translated: This is the example.

original: dge ba'i phyogs la yang de bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i phyogs la yang de bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The same should be applied to the side of virtue.

original: bden pa rnams ni mngon par rtogs pa dang mthun par bstan pa yin no zhes bya ba ni gzhan du na rgyu dang 'bras bu sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung ba'i bden pa sngar dang phyis bstan pa dag phyis dang sngar bstan par thal bar 'gyur ro zhes stonüîΩpar byed do //
analyzed: bden pa rnams ni mngon par rtogs pa dang mthun par bstan pa yin no zhes bya ba ni gzhan du na rgyu dang 'bras bu sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung ba'i bden pa sngar dang phyis bstan pa dag phyis dang sngar bstan par thal bar 'gyur ro zhes ston par byed do //
translated: The truths are taught in accordance with realization. This shows that otherwise, if cause and effect, the truths of suffering and origin, were taught first and later, it would follow that they would be taught later and first.

original: gang la chags pa zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa la'o //
analyzed: gang la chags pa zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa la'o //

original: gang gis gnod pa byed pa zhes bya ba ni de nyid kyis so //
analyzed: gang gis gnod pa byed pa zhes bya ba ni de nyid kyis so //

original: gang las thar ba zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa de kho na las te /
analyzed: gang las thar ba zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa de kho na las te /

original: de nyid la dang por te sbyor ba'i gnas skabs su'o //
analyzed: de nyid la dang por te sbyor ba'i gnas skabs su'o //
translated: That is, at the beginning, i.e., at the stage of application.

original: gang du zhe na /
analyzed: gang du zhe na /

original: rnam par dpyod pa'i gnas skabs na zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: rnam par dpyod pa'i gnas skabs na zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: In the stage of investigation.

original: yongs su rtogs pa'i gnas skabs na ste /
analyzed: yongs su rtogs pa'i gnas skabs na ste /
translated: In the stage of thorough understanding.

original: nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i gnas skabs na zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i gnas skabs na zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: In the stage of the factors conducive to penetration.

original: nad mthong nas zhes bya ba la sogs @151b pa 'byung ba la nad ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'i dpe yin no //
analyzed: nad mthong nas zhes bya ba la sogs @151b pa 'byung ba la nad ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'i dpe yin no //
translated: Having seen the disease, etc. The disease is an example of the truth of suffering.

original: de'i gzhi ni kun 'byung gi bden pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i gzhi ni kun 'byung gi bden pa yin no //
translated: Its basis is the truth of origination.

original: de zad pa ni 'gog pa'i bden pa yin no //
analyzed: de zad pa ni 'gog pa'i bden pa yin no //

original: de'i sman ni lam gyi bden pa'i dpe yin no //
analyzed: de'i sman ni lam gyi bden pa'i dpe yin no //
translated: The medicine for it is an example of the truth of the path.üîΩThis example of the truths is also taught in the sutras.

original: bden pa rnams kyi dpe 'di ni mdo las kyang bstan to zhes bya ba ni nang la sogs pa'i mdo las so //
analyzed: bden pa rnams kyi dpe 'di ni mdo las kyang bstan to zhes bya ba ni nang la sogs pa'i mdo las so //
translated: In the sutras on the internal and external senses, etc.

original: ji skad du zhe na /
analyzed: ji skad du zhe na /
translated: What does it say?

original: yan lag bzhi dang ldan pa'i sman pa zug rngu 'byin pa ni rgyal po'i 'os yin zhing rgyal po'i spu la 'bab pa yin la rgyal po'i yan lag nyid kyi grangs su yang 'gro'o //
analyzed: yan lag bzhi dang ldan pa'i sman pa zug rngu 'byin pa ni rgyal po'i 'os yin zhing rgyal po'i spu la 'bab pa yin la rgyal po'i yan lag nyid kyi grangs su yang 'gro'o //
translated: The king should be a physician who has four qualities and removes pain. He is worthy of the king, is fit to be the king‚Äôs hair-washer, and is counted among the king‚Äôs limbs.

original: bzhi po gang dag ce na /
analyzed: bzhi po gang dag ce na /
translated: What are the four?

original: nad la mkhas pa yin /
analyzed: nad la mkhas pa yin /

original: nad kyi gzhi la mkhas pa yin /
analyzed: nad kyi gzhi la mkhas pa yin /

analyzed: nad spong ba la mkhas pa yin nad spangs nas phyir mi skye ba la mkhas pa yin no //
translated: He is skilled in removing the disease. He is skilled in preventing the disease from recurring after it has been removed.

original: de bzhin du yan lag bzhi dang ldan pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyang sman pa zug rngu 'byin pa bla na med pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du yan lag bzhi dang ldan pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyang sman pa zug rngu 'byin pa bla na med pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: In the same way, the TathƒÅgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One, who has four qualities, is called the unsurpassed physician who removes pain.

original: bzhi po gang dag ce na /
analyzed: bzhi po gang dag ce na /
translated: What are the four?

original: dge slong dag 'di na de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis ni 'di ni sdug bsngal 'phags pa'i bden pa'o zhes bya ba yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: dge slong dag 'di na de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis ni 'di ni sdug bsngal 'phags pa'i bden pa'o zhes bya ba yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: ‚ÄúMonks, the TathƒÅgata, Arhat, Perfectly Enlightened Buddha knows this: This is the noble truth of suffering.

original: 'di ni sdug bsngal kun 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sdug bsngal kun 'byung ba'o //
translated: This is the origin of suffering.

original: 'di ni sdug bsngal 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sdug bsngal 'gog pa'o //
translated: This is the cessation of suffering.

original: 'di ni sdug bsngal 'gog par 'gro ba'i lam 'phags pa'i bden pa'o zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mkhyen to zhes 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni sdug bsngal 'gog par 'gro ba'i lam 'phags pa'i bden pa'o zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mkhyen to zhes 'byung ba yin no //
translated: This is the noble truth of the path that leads to the cessation of suffering.‚Äù

original: sngar 'phangs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni sngon gyi shugs kyis so //üîΩdkyus bstan pa'i rta thags thogs med par rgyug pa bzhin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sngar 'phangs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni sngon gyi shugs kyis so // dkyus bstan pa'i rta thags thogs med par rgyug pa bzhin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Because it was previously projected means by the momentum of the past.üîΩLike a horse running without obstruction on a straight course means

analyzed: rta ji ltar dkyus kyis bstan pa la 'gyur ba med par rgyug pa de dang 'dra'o //

analyzed: kha cig ni thags thogs med par dkyus snyol ba bzhin no zhes 'don to //
translated: Some say: They are like a horse and rider, respectively.üîΩThere is also a difference in substance.

original: rdzas su yang bye brag yod de zhes bya ba la yang zhes bya ba'i sgras ni ming gi sgo nas kyang zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: rdzas su yang bye brag yod de zhes bya ba la yang zhes bya ba'i sgras ni ming gi sgo nas kyang zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: The word also indicates that there is also a difference in name.

original: phyin ci ma log pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar de ni 'phags pa rnams dang / gzhan dag la yang phyin ci ma log pa ste /
analyzed: phyin ci ma log pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar de ni 'phags pa rnams dang / gzhan dag la yang phyin ci ma log pa ste /
translated: Because they are unmistaken means that they are unmistaken for both ƒÅryas and others.

original: sdug bsngal la sogs pa kho na yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal la sogs pa kho na yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no //
translated: They are only suffering and so on, they are not anything else.

original: 'phags pa rnams kyis ni bden pa 'di dag ji lta ba de kho na bzhin du gzigs te /
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams kyis ni bden pa 'di dag ji lta ba de kho na bzhin du gzigs te /
translated: ƒÄryas see these truths exactly as they are.üîΩThey see the truth of suffering as suffering, impermanent,

original: sdug bsngal gyi bden pa la yang sdug bsngal dang / mi rtag pa dang / stong @152a * //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi bden pa la yang sdug bsngal dang / mi rtag pa dang / stong @152a * //
translated: empty,

original: pa dang / bdag med par gzigs la /
analyzed: pa dang / bdag med par gzigs la /

analyzed: de bzhin du lam gyi bden pa la yang lam dang rigs pa dang / sgrub pa dang / nges par 'byin pa'i bar du gzigs kyi 'phags pa ma yin pa gzhan dag gis ni de ltar mthong ba ma yin pas de'i phyir 'di dag ni 'phags pa rnams kyi bden pa zhes bya'i /

analyzed: bde ba'i tshor ba med do zhes bya ba'i skabs dang sbyar ro //
translated: This is connected with the statement ‚Äúthere is no feeling of pleasure.‚Äù

original: sdug bsngal gyi bye brag la ci zhe na /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi bye brag la ci zhe na /
translated: What about the distinction of suffering?

original: bde ba'i blo skye ba'i phyir de bzhin du bde ba'i tshor ba med do zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: bde ba'i blo skye ba'i phyir de bzhin du bde ba'i tshor ba med do zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The idea of pleasure arises in regard to the distinction of suffering, so the same should be said, i.e., ‚Äúthere is no feeling of pleasure.‚Äù

original: sdug bsngal gyi gnyen po la bde ba'i blo skye ba bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi gnyen po la bde ba'i blo skye ba bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that the idea of pleasure arises in regard to the antidote of pain, he says:

original: ji skad du bkres pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgyas par smos so //
analyzed: ji skad du bkres pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgyas par smos so //
translated: ‚ÄúFor example, when one is hungry, etc.‚ÄùüîΩIn order to demonstrate that the idea of pleasure arises in regard to a particular kind of pain, he says:

original: sdug bsngal gyi bye brag la bde ba'i blo skyes pa bstan pa'i phyir byis pa rnams ni sdug bsngal gyi bye brag la yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgya cher smos so //üîΩphrag pa nas phrag par khur sbed pa khur tsa ba rnams khur gyis non te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi bye brag la bde ba'i blo skyes pa bstan pa'i phyir byis pa rnams ni sdug bsngal gyi bye brag la yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgya cher smos so // phrag pa nas phrag par khur sbed pa khur tsa ba rnams khur gyis non te /
translated: ‚ÄúFools, etc.‚Äù

original: sdug bsngal ba kho nar gnas bzhin du bde'o snyam du blo skyed par byed do //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba kho nar gnas bzhin du bde'o snyam du blo skyed par byed do //
translated: The porters, who carry loads from one shoulder to the other, are oppressed by their loads and, while remaining in pain, generate the idea of pleasure.

original: 'di nyid rigs pa yin no zhes zer ba ni slob dpon no //
analyzed: 'di nyid rigs pa yin no zhes zer ba ni slob dpon no //
translated: The Master says that this is the correct explanation.

original: 'phags pa rnams mi bzhed pa yin te zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i bde ba'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams mi bzhed pa yin te zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i bde ba'o //
translated: The noble ones do not accept it, i.e., the pleasure of the realm of desire.

original: mi 'dod pa ni gzhan du yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni bag med ba'i gnas nyid la sogs pa'i rnam pa gzhan gyis so //
analyzed: mi 'dod pa ni gzhan du yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni bag med ba'i gnas nyid la sogs pa'i rnam pa gzhan gyis so //
translated: It is not accepted in another way, i.e., in another way, by other aspects, such as being the basis of heedlessness.

original: don de bstan par bya ba'i phyir tshor ba gang zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa rgyas par smos te /
analyzed: don de bstan par bya ba'i phyir tshor ba gang zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa rgyas par smos te /
translated: In order to demonstrate that meaning, he says, ‚ÄúWhatever feeling there is,‚Äù and so on.

original: bag med pa'i gnas zhes bya ba ni bde ba las nyams pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bag med pa'i gnas zhes bya ba ni bde ba las nyams pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe basis of heedlessness‚Äù means that it is the cause of the loss of pleasure.

original: mngon @155b par 'du bya ba chen pos bsgrub par bya ba dang / rnam par 'gyur ba can ni mjug thogs su sdug bsngal skye ba can dang / sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa skye ba can zhes bya ba'i don nam /
analyzed: mngon @155b par 'du bya ba chen pos bsgrub par bya ba dang / rnam par 'gyur ba can ni mjug thogs su sdug bsngal skye ba can dang / sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa skye ba can zhes bya ba'i don nam /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthat is to be accomplished with great effort‚Äù means that it is subject to change, that is, it is the cause of the arising of pain or the cause of the arising of neither pleasure nor pain.

original: yang na ngo bo nyams par gyur pa zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: yang na ngo bo nyams par gyur pa zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Or, it means that it is subject to the loss of its essential nature.

original: mi rtag par zhes bya ba ni rnam par 'jig par zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mi rtag par zhes bya ba ni rnam par 'jig par zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúit is impermanent‚Äù means that it is subject to destruction.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid kyi rnam pas ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni phan 'dogs par byed pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid kyi rnam pa ste /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid kyi rnam pas ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni phan 'dogs par byed pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid kyi rnam pa ste /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúnot in terms of its own intrinsic nature‚Äù means that it is not in terms of the intrinsic nature that is beneficial.

original: bde ba'i tshor ba ni 'phags pa rnams la yang phan 'dogs par byed pas mi slu ba yin no //üîΩgal te bde ba'i tshor ba 'di rang gi mtshan nyid kyis te /
analyzed: bde ba'i tshor ba ni 'phags pa rnams la yang phan 'dogs par byed pas mi slu ba yin no // gal te bde ba'i tshor ba 'di rang gi mtshan nyid kyis te /
translated: Pleasant feeling is not deceptive for noble ones, since it also benefits them.üîΩIf this pleasant feeling were undesirable by its intrinsic nature,

original: phan 'dogs par byed pa'i bdag nyid kyis mi 'dod pa zhig yin par gyur na ni bde ba'i tshor ba de la su yang 'dod chags skye bar mi 'gyur ba zhig ste /
analyzed: phan 'dogs par byed pa'i bdag nyid kyis mi 'dod pa zhig yin par gyur na ni bde ba'i tshor ba de la su yang 'dod chags skye bar mi 'gyur ba zhig ste /
translated: that is, by its very being beneficial, then no one would become attached to that pleasant feeling,

original: sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba bzhin no snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba bzhin no snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: just as no one becomes attached to a painful feeling.üîΩThis is the thought behind the objection.

original: gang gi phyir 'dod chags dang 'bral ba'i ched du zhes bya ba ni rgyu gang gi phyir 'dod chags dang 'bral bar bya ba'i ched du rnam pa gzhan gyis kyang skyon can du lta bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'dod chags dang 'bral ba'i ched du zhes bya ba ni rgyu gang gi phyir 'dod chags dang 'bral bar bya ba'i ched du rnam pa gzhan gyis kyang skyon can du lta bar 'gyur te /
translated: The response is, ‚ÄúSince it is for the sake of freedom from attachment,‚Äù that is, for the sake of freedom from attachment to pleasant feeling.

original: gzhan du na tshegs mad pa kho nar 'dod chags med pa 'grub pas 'dod chags dang bral bar bya ba'i ched du 'bad pa don med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na tshegs mad pa kho nar 'dod chags med pa 'grub pas 'dod chags dang bral bar bya ba'i ched du 'bad pa don med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, freedom from attachment would be accomplished without effort, and striving for freedom from attachment would be pointless.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis gang ci tshor yang rung de ni 'dir sdug bsngal lo zhes kyang gsungs na zhes bya ba'i mdo'i tshig 'di ni gnas brtan kun dga' bos bzlas pa yin no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis gang ci tshor yang rung de ni 'dir sdug bsngal lo zhes kyang gsungs na zhes bya ba'i mdo'i tshig 'di ni gnas brtan kun dga' bos bzlas pa yin no //
translated: The elder Ananda recited the words of the sutra, ‚ÄúThe Blessed One said, ‚ÄòWhatever is felt is included in suffering here.‚Äô‚Äù

original: des kyang 'di skad du zhus par 'gyur la zhes bya ba ni gnas brtan kun dga' bos gang ci tshor yang rung de ni 'dir sdug bsngal lo zhes bya ba'i tshig 'di rigs pa ma yin pa'i ngo bor mthong na ni de kho na zhus par 'gyur te
analyzed: des kyang 'di skad du zhus par 'gyur la zhes bya ba ni gnas brtan kun dga' bos gang ci tshor yang rung de ni 'dir sdug bsngal lo zhes bya ba'i tshig 'di rigs pa ma yin pa'i ngo bor mthong na ni de kho na zhus par 'gyur te
translated: If he saw that the words ‚ÄúWhatever is felt is included in suffering here‚Äù were of an illogical nature, then he would have asked,

original: / gang ci tshor yang rung de ni 'dir sdug bsngal lo zhes bya ba 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: / gang ci tshor yang rung de ni 'dir sdug bsngal lo zhes bya ba 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúWhy is it that the Blessed One said, ‚ÄòWhatever is felt is included in suffering here,‚Äô because that is contradictory.

original: gal te tshor ba gsum zhes bya ba 'di rigs pa ma yin pa'i ngo bor mthong na ni bcom ldan 'das kyis ci las dgongs nas tshor ba gsum zhes bka' stsal zhes zhus par 'gyur te de 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gal te tshor ba gsum zhes bya ba 'di rigs pa ma yin pa'i ngo bor mthong na ni bcom ldan 'das kyis ci las dgongs nas tshor ba gsum zhes bka' stsal zhes zhus par 'gyur te de 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If he saw that the statement, ‚ÄúThere are three kinds of feeling‚Äù was of an illogical nature, then he would have asked, ‚ÄúWhy is it that the Blessed One said, ‚ÄòThere are three kinds of feeling,‚Äô because that is contradictory.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang 'di skad du tshor ba gsum zhes bya ba 'di ni ngas dgongs nas bshad pa yin no zhes lung bstan par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang 'di skad du tshor ba gsum zhes bya ba 'di ni ngas dgongs nas bshad pa yin no zhes lung bstan par 'gyur gyi /
translated: The BhagavƒÅn would also make the following prediction: ‚ÄúI taught this in consideration of the three feelings.‚Äù

original: 'di skad du gang ci tshor yang rung de ni 'dir sdug bsngal lo zhes bya ba ni ngas 'du byed mi rtag pa nyid dang / 'du byed rnam par 'gyur ba nyid las @156a * //
analyzed: 'di skad du gang ci tshor yang rung de ni 'dir sdug bsngal lo zhes bya ba ni ngas 'du byed mi rtag pa nyid dang / 'du byed rnam par 'gyur ba nyid las @156a * //
translated: He would not make the following prediction: ‚ÄúI taught whatever is felt is suffering in consideration of the impermanence of compounded phenomena and the transformation of compounded phenomena.‚Äù

original: dgongs nas gsungs so zhes lung bstan par yang mi 'gyur ba zhig na yang tshor ba gsum smos pa'i phyir de skad kyang bka' ma stsal te /
analyzed: dgongs nas gsungs so zhes lung bstan par yang mi 'gyur ba zhig na yang tshor ba gsum smos pa'i phyir de skad kyang bka' ma stsal te /
translated: But he did not say this because he mentioned three feelings.

original: de lta bas na tshor ba gsum ni rang gi ngo bos yod la /
analyzed: de lta bas na tshor ba gsum ni rang gi ngo bos yod la /
translated: Therefore the three feelings exist by their own nature.

original: gang ci tshor yang rung de ni 'dir sdug bsngal lo zhes bya ba 'di ni ngas dgongs nas bshad pa yin no zhes gsungs pa'i phyir gang ci tshor yang rung de ni 'dir sdug bsngal lo zhes bya ba'i tshig 'di ni bcom ldan 'das kyis dgongs pa can
analyzed: gang ci tshor yang rung de ni 'dir sdug bsngal lo zhes bya ba 'di ni ngas dgongs nas bshad pa yin no zhes gsungs pa'i phyir gang ci tshor yang rung de ni 'dir sdug bsngal lo zhes bya ba'i tshig 'di ni bcom ldan 'das kyis dgongs pa can
translated: This statement by the Blessed One shows that the words whatever is felt is suffering in this context are

original: du ston par mdzad pa yin te /üîΩ'du byed 'gyur ba nyid las dgongs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: du ston par mdzad pa yin te / 'du byed 'gyur ba nyid las dgongs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: intentionalüîΩbecause he intended to say that conditioned states are impermanent.üîΩBecause they are subject to change and are impermanent.

original: rnam par 'gyur ba dang / mi rtag pa'i chos can yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rnam par 'gyur ba'i chos can yin pa'i phyir dang / mi rtag pa'i chos can yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: rnam par 'gyur ba dang / mi rtag pa'i chos can yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rnam par 'gyur ba'i chos can yin pa'i phyir dang / mi rtag pa'i chos can yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: They are subject to change because they are subject to transformation and they are impermanent because they do not endure.

original: rnam par 'gyur ba ni gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid do //
analyzed: rnam par 'gyur ba ni gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid do //
translated: Change means transformation.

original: 'dod pa'i yon tan zhes bya ba 'di ni gzugs dang sgra dang / dri dang ro dang reg bya yid du 'ong ba rnams kyi ming yin no //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i yon tan zhes bya ba 'di ni gzugs dang sgra dang / dri dang ro dang reg bya yid du 'ong ba rnams kyi ming yin no //
translated: The term objects of desire refers to desirable form, sound, smell, taste, and tactility.

original: skye ba yang skye ba yid du 'ong ba'i ming yin te /
analyzed: skye ba yang skye ba yid du 'ong ba'i ming yin te /
translated: Birth is also a pleasant name for birth.üîΩBirth is also like that, with little pleasure and much pain.

original: skye ba yang de 'dra bar bde ba ni chung la sdug bsngal ni mang ba yin na gcig tu bde bar lta ba ni phyin ci log pa yin no //
analyzed: skye ba yang de 'dra bar bde ba ni chung la sdug bsngal ni mang ba yin na gcig tu bde bar lta ba ni phyin ci log pa yin no //
translated: If you think that birth is only pleasure, that is a misconception.

original: gal te 'jig rten dang mthun par gsungs pa yin no zhe na zhes bya ba ni ji ste 'jig rten gyi tshor ba rtogs pa dang mthun par tshor ba gsum mo zhes gsungs so zhe na /
analyzed: gal te 'jig rten dang mthun par gsungs pa yin no zhe na zhes bya ba ni ji ste 'jig rten gyi tshor ba rtogs pa dang mthun par tshor ba gsum mo zhes gsungs so zhe na /
translated: If you think that the three feelings are taught in accordance with the understanding of worldly beings,

original: de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te /
translated: that is not so.

original: tshor ba thams cad sdug bsngal ba nyid ni dgongs nas gsungs so zhes bka' stsal ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: tshor ba thams cad sdug bsngal ba nyid ni dgongs nas gsungs so zhes bka' stsal ba'i phyir te /
translated: The Buddha taught that all feelings are suffering, intending that.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis kun dga' bo gang ci tshor yang rung ste 'di ni sdug bsngal lo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis kun dga' bo gang ci tshor yang rung ste 'di ni sdug bsngal lo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The BhagavƒÅn said, ‚ÄúƒÄnanda, whatever is felt is suffering.

original: ngas 'du byed mi rtag pa nyid dang / 'du byed rnam par 'gyur ba nyid las dgongs nas gsungs so zhes dgongs te /
analyzed: ngas 'du byed mi rtag pa nyid dang / 'du byed rnam par 'gyur ba nyid las dgongs nas gsungs so zhes dgongs te /
translated: I taught that intending the impermanence of conditioned phenomena and the transformation of conditioned phenomena.

original: bshad pa yin par bka' stsal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bshad pa yin par bka' stsal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is said to be an explanation.

original: de'i phyir 'jig rten dang mthun par tshor ba gsum zhes gsungs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'jig rten dang mthun par tshor ba gsum zhes gsungs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the statement, ‚ÄúThere are three feelings,‚Äù is not made in accordance with the world.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What then?

original: rang gi mtshan nyid kyi sgo nas nges par 'dzin par mdzad do zhes bya bar bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid kyi sgo nas nges par 'dzin par mdzad do zhes bya bar bsams pa yin no //
translated: The intended meaning is that the Buddha ascertains feelings from the perspective of their intrinsic nature.

original: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin zhes gsungs pa'i yang phyir 'jig rten dang mthun par tshor ba gsum mo zhes gsungs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin zhes gsungs pa'i yang phyir 'jig rten dang mthun par tshor ba gsum mo zhes gsungs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Also, because it is said, ‚Äúin reality,‚Äù the statement, ‚ÄúThere are three feelings,‚Äù is not made in accordance with the world.

original: ji lta zhe na /üîΩbde ba'i dbang po gang yin pa dang / yid bde ba'i dbang po gang yin pa 'di ni bde ba'i tshor ba yin par blta bar bya'o zhes rgyas par gsungs nas zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na / bde ba'i dbang po gang yin pa dang / yid bde ba'i dbang po gang yin pa 'di ni bde ba'i tshor ba yin par blta bar bya'o zhes rgyas par gsungs nas zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: What is the meaning of this statement?üîΩThe root text states, ‚ÄúWhatever is the faculty of pleasure and whatever is the faculty of mental pleasure should be regarded as the feeling of pleasure.‚Äù

original: sdug @156b bsngal gyi dbang po gang yin pa 'di ni bde ba'i tshor ba yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: sdug @156b bsngal gyi dbang po gang yin pa 'di ni bde ba'i tshor ba yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: Whatever is the faculty of pain should be regarded as the feeling of pain.

original: yid mi bde ba'i dbang po gang yin pa 'di ni sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba yin no //
analyzed: yid mi bde ba'i dbang po gang yin pa 'di ni sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba yin no //
translated: The faculty of sorrow is the feeling of pain.üîΩThe faculty of equanimity is the feeling that is neither pleasure nor pain.

original: btang snyoms kyi dbang po gang yin pa 'di ni bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba yin no zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa rgyas par gsungs nas so //
analyzed: btang snyoms kyi dbang po gang yin pa 'di ni bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba yin no zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa rgyas par gsungs nas so //
translated: This is the extensive explanation.

original: 'dir tshor ba gsum yod pa'i khungs ni gang gis dbang po lnga po 'di dag de ltar yang dag pa'i shes rab kyis yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mthong zhing zhes bya ba 'di yin te /
analyzed: 'dir tshor ba gsum yod pa'i khungs ni gang gis dbang po lnga po 'di dag de ltar yang dag pa'i shes rab kyis yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mthong zhing zhes bya ba 'di yin te /
translated: The source for the existence of three feelings is the passage that begins with the words, ‚ÄúOne who sees these five faculties in this way with correct wisdom sees correctly.‚Äù

original: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin zhes bya ba ni sgro 'dogs pa med pa dang / skur pa 'debs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin zhes bya ba ni sgro 'dogs pa med pa dang / skur pa 'debs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúCorrectly‚Äù means without exaggeration or denigration.

original: 'jig rten yang ji ltar na sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba la bde ba dang sdug bsngal dang bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa rnam pa gsum du rtogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'jig rten yang ji ltar na sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba la bde ba dang sdug bsngal dang bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa rnam pa gsum du rtogs par 'gyur te /
translated: How can the world understand the three types of feelings in the feeling of pain?

original: sdug bsngal gyi ngo bo nyid kyis sdug bsngal du rtogs pa kho nar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi ngo bo nyid kyis sdug bsngal du rtogs pa kho nar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it would be realized only as suffering by the very essence of suffering.üîΩIf you say that the mental satisfaction of the first two absorptions is pleasure,üîΩthen the mental satisfaction of the third absorption would not be pleasure.üîΩIf you say that the mental satisfaction of the first two absorptions is pleasure,

original: gal te chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen po dag la zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni ji ste sdug bsngal chung ngu la ni bde ba'i blo 'byung la /üîΩchen po la ni sdug bsngal gyi blo 'byung /üîΩ'bring la ni bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa'i blo 'byung ngo zhe na /
analyzed: gal te chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen po dag la zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni ji ste sdug bsngal chung ngu la ni bde ba'i blo 'byung la / chen po la ni sdug bsngal gyi blo 'byung / 'bring la ni bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa'i blo 'byung ngo zhe na /
translated: then the mental satisfaction of the third absorption would not be pleasure because it is said that the mental satisfaction of the third absorption is neither pleasure nor pain.üîΩIf you say that the mental satisfaction of the first two absorptions is pleasure,üîΩthen the mental satisfaction of the third absorption would not be pleasure because it is said that the mental satisfaction of the third absorption is neither pleasure nor pain.

original: 'di la bde ba la yang rnam pa gsum yod pas zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /üîΩchung ngu dang 'bring dang chen po tha dad pas so //
analyzed: 'di la bde ba la yang rnam pa gsum yod pas zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te / chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen po tha dad pas so //
translated: If you say that the mental satisfaction of the first two absorptions is pleasure,

original: sdug bsngal chung ngu la sogs pa la zhes bya ba ni chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen po dag la'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal chung ngu la sogs pa la zhes bya ba ni chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen po dag la'o //
translated: then the mental satisfaction of the third absorption would not be pleasure because it is said that the mental satisfaction of the third absorption is neither pleasure nor pain.

original: bde ba chen po la sogs pa'i blo skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni bde ba chen po dang 'bring dang chung ngu'i blo skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bde ba chen po la sogs pa'i blo skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni bde ba chen po dang 'bring dang chung ngu'i blo skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning of the above passage is that the mental states of great pleasure, medium pleasure, and lesser pleasure arise.

original: ji lta zhe na sdug bsngal chung ngu la ni bde ba chen po'i blo skye bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na sdug bsngal chung ngu la ni bde ba chen po'i blo skye bar 'gyur la /
translated: How so? The mental state of great pleasure arises in regard to lesser pain.

original: 'bring la ni bde ba 'bring gi blo skye bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: 'bring la ni bde ba 'bring gi blo skye bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: The mental state of medium pleasure arises in regard to medium pain.

original: chen po la ni bde ba chung ngu'i blo skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chen po la ni bde ba chung ngu'i blo skye bar 'gyur ro //

analyzed: dper na sa bon ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni s'a lu'i sa bon ni s'a lu'i myu gu skye ba'i rgyu yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, a seed is the cause of the arising of a rice sprout, etc.

original: chu ni bye brag med par ji ltar s'a lu'i myu gu skye ba'i rgyu yin pa de bzhin du nas kyi yang yin pas de'i phyir de ni myu gu thams cad skye ba tsam gyi rgyu yin pa lta bu'o //üîΩsred pa med na skye ba med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba 'di la sgrub pa ni skye ba'i rgyu ni srid pa yin te /
analyzed: chu ni bye brag med par ji ltar s'a lu'i myu gu skye ba'i rgyu yin pa de bzhin du nas kyi yang yin pas de'i phyir de ni myu gu thams cad skye ba tsam gyi rgyu yin pa lta bu'o // sred pa med na skye ba med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba 'di la sgrub pa ni skye ba'i rgyu ni srid pa yin te /
translated: Water is the cause of the arising of all sprouts, because it is the cause of the arising of a rice sprout, etc., without distinction.üîΩBecause there is no arising when there is no craving.

original: de yod dam med na de yod pa dang med pa'i phyir dper na myu gu'i sa bon lta bu'o //
analyzed: de yod dam med na de yod pa dang med pa'i phyir dper na myu gu'i sa bon lta bu'o //
translated: The proof of this is as follows: Existence is the cause of birth, because birth exists when it exists and does not exist when it does not exist, like a sprout from a seed.üîΩBecause the continuum is directed.

original: rgyud gzhol ba'i yang phyir te zhes bya ba 'di'i don rnam par dgrol ba'i phyir gang la sred pa dang bcas pa zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /
analyzed: rgyud gzhol ba'i yang phyir te zhes bya ba 'di'i don rnam par dgrol ba'i phyir gang la sred pa dang bcas pa zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /
translated: In order to explain the meaning of this, he says:

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i yul gang la sems kyi rgyud sred pa dang bcas pa der sems kyi rgyud yang dang yang du gzhol bar mthong bas /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i yul gang la sems kyi rgyud sred pa dang bcas pa der sems kyi rgyud yang dang yang du gzhol bar mthong bas /
translated: The continuum of mind is seen to be drawn again and again to the objects of form, etc.

original: de lta bas na yang srid pa la yang sems kyi rgyud sred pa dang bcas pa de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na yang srid pa la yang sems kyi rgyud sred pa dang bcas pa de dang 'dra'o //
translated: Therefore, the continuum of mind is also drawn to renewed existence, because it is associated with craving.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de la gzhol bas te /
analyzed: de la gzhol bas te /
translated: Because it is drawn to that.

original: gang la gzhol ba de la ni 'jug par shes so //
analyzed: gang la gzhol ba de la ni 'jug par shes so //
translated: It is understood that it is drawn to that to which it is directed.

original: 'di la grub pa ni yang sred pa la sems kyi rgyud sred pa dang bcas pa 'jug par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di la grub pa ni yang sred pa la sems kyi rgyud sred pa dang bcas pa 'jug par 'gyur te /
translated: Here, the proof is that the continuum of mind is directed to renewed existence, because it is associated with craving,

original: gzhol ba'i phyir gzugs la sogs pa'i yul la gzhol ba bzhin no //
analyzed: gzhol ba'i phyir gzugs la sogs pa'i yul la gzhol ba bzhin no //
translated: just as it is directed to the objects of form, etc.

original: 'dag pa'i chal sran chung gi phye ma'i lde gu skams pas lus bzung ba bzhin du zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'dag pa'i chal sran chung gi phye ma'i lde gu skams pas lus bzung ba bzhin du zhes bya ba la /
translated: Like a body smeared with a thick paste of chickpea flour used for bathing.

original: 'dag pa'i chal sran chung gi phye ni khrus kyi chal sran chung gi phye'o //
analyzed: 'dag pa'i chal sran chung gi phye ni khrus kyi chal sran chung gi phye'o //
translated: Chickpea flour is a paste of chickpea meal.

original: de'i lde gu ni 'di la 'dag pa'i chal sran chung gi phye ma'i lde gu skam po yod pas na 'dag pa'i chal sran chung gi phye ma'i lde gu skams pas lus bzung ba'o //üîΩde dang 'dra bar te /
analyzed: de'i lde gu ni 'di la 'dag pa'i chal sran chung gi phye ma'i lde gu skam po yod pas na 'dag pa'i chal sran chung gi phye ma'i lde gu skams pas lus bzung ba'o // de dang 'dra bar te /
translated: The dry powder of white mustard seed is its powder.

original: dper na 'dag pa'i chal sran chung gi phye ma'i lde gu skams pas lus bzung ba de bzhin du sred pas lus bzung ngo zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: dper na 'dag pa'i chal sran chung gi phye ma'i lde gu skams pas lus bzung ba de bzhin du sred pas lus bzung ngo zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: The body is held together by the dry powder of white mustard seed, just as the body is held together by craving.

original: 'di ni rigs pa yin no zhes bya ba ni mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu sred pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don 'di la'o //
analyzed: 'di ni rigs pa yin no zhes bya ba ni mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu sred pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don 'di la'o //
translated: This is the correct interpretation.

original: bden pa gnyis zhes kyang @160b gsungs zhes bya ba 'di ni bden pa bzhi'i zhar la smos pa yin no //
analyzed: bden pa gnyis zhes kyang @160b gsungs zhes bya ba 'di ni bden pa bzhi'i zhar la smos pa yin no //
translated: The statement, ‚ÄúThe two truths were also taught,‚Äù is a digression on the four noble truths.

original: bum chu bzhin zhes bya ba ni 'jig pa gnyis nye bar bstan pa'i phyir dpe gnyis nye bar bkod pa yin te /
analyzed: bum chu bzhin zhes bya ba ni 'jig pa gnyis nye bar bstan pa'i phyir dpe gnyis nye bar bkod pa yin te /
translated: The example of a pot and water is given to illustrate the two kinds of cessation.

original: 'joms pas 'jig pa ni bum pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'joms pas 'jig pa ni bum pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The cessation that is destruction is a pot, etc.

original: blos 'jig pa ni chu la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: blos 'jig pa ni chu la sogs pa ste /
translated: The cessation that is a non-arising is water, etc.

original: chu la sogs pa la ni bcom pas ro la sogs pa bsal bar mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chu la sogs pa la ni bcom pas ro la sogs pa bsal bar mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But it is not tenable that the taste, etc., of water, etc., are eliminated by destruction, because they are not destroyed.

original: rnam pa gcig tu na kun rdzob ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: rnam pa gcig tu na kun rdzob ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: In another way, the conventional is twofold:

original: kun rdzob gzhan la brten pa dang / rdzas gzhan la brten pa'o //
analyzed: kun rdzob gzhan la brten pa dang / rdzas gzhan la brten pa'o //
translated: that which is based on another conventional and that which is based on another substance.

original: de la kun rdzob gzhan la brten pa gang yin pa de la ni 'jig pa yang srid la gzhan sel ba yang srid do //
analyzed: de la kun rdzob gzhan la brten pa gang yin pa de la ni 'jig pa yang srid la gzhan sel ba yang srid do //
translated: In that which is based on another conventional, destruction is possible and the exclusion of another is possible.

original: rdzas gzhan la brten pa gang yin pa de la ni gzhan sel ba kho na srid kyi 'jig pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rdzas gzhan la brten pa gang yin pa de la ni gzhan sel ba kho na srid kyi 'jig pa ma yin te /
translated: In that which is based on another substance, only the exclusion of another is possible, not destruction.

original: rdul phra rab rdzas brgyad la cha shas su dbral bar ni mi nus so //
analyzed: rdul phra rab rdzas brgyad la cha shas su dbral bar ni mi nus so //
translated: For it is not possible to divide a substance, an atom, into parts.

original: kun rdzob tu yod de zhes bya ba ni tha snyad du yod pa'o //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu yod de zhes bya ba ni tha snyad du yod pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúExists conventionally‚Äù means exists nominally.

original: don dam yod ces bya ba ni don dam par yod pa ste /
analyzed: don dam yod ces bya ba ni don dam par yod pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúExists ultimately‚Äù means exists ultimately.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid du yod pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid du yod pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It means exists by intrinsic identity.

original: tshor ba yod pa la sogs pa yang de bzhin du blta bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / sems pa la sogs pa yang rdzas su yod pa kho nar lta'o //
analyzed: tshor ba yod pa la sogs pa yang de bzhin du blta bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / sems pa la sogs pa yang rdzas su yod pa kho nar lta'o //
translated: Feeling, etc. should be understood in the same way.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: tshor ba la sogs pa'i chos rnams ni blos bsal na tshor ba'i ngo bo nyid kyi blo 'byung bas tshor ba ni rdzas su yod pa yin te /
analyzed: tshor ba la sogs pa'i chos rnams ni blos bsal na tshor ba'i ngo bo nyid kyi blo 'byung bas tshor ba ni rdzas su yod pa yin te /
translated: The dharmas of feeling, etc. are substantially existent because the cognition of feeling, etc. arises when they are distinguished by the mind.

original: 'du shes dang sems pa la sogs pa la yang de bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'du shes dang sems pa la sogs pa la yang de bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The same should be applied to perception, intention, etc.üîΩWhen it is said that a pot and water exist, only the truth is spoken, not a lie.

original: bum pa dang chu yod do zhes brjod pa na bden pa kho nar smras pa yin gyi brdzun pa ni ma yin pas zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa smos pa'i dgongs pa ston par byed de /
analyzed: bum pa dang chu yod do zhes brjod pa na bden pa kho nar smras pa yin gyi brdzun pa ni ma yin pas zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa smos pa'i dgongs pa ston par byed de /
translated: The intention of mentioning conventional truth is shown.

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyis chos bstan pa //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyis chos bstan pa //
translated: The teaching of the Dharma by the Buddhas

original: bden pa gnyis la brten nas te //
analyzed: bden pa gnyis la brten nas te //
translated: is based on the two truths:üîΩthe conventional truth of the world

original: 'jig rten kun rdzob bden pa dang / dam pa'i don gyi bden pa'o //üîΩzhes bshad do //
analyzed: 'jig rten kun rdzob bden pa dang / dam pa'i don gyi bden pa'o //üîΩzhes bshad do //
translated: and the truth of ultimate meaning.

original: de bzhin du don dam pa'i bden pa zhes bya ba ni ye shes dam pa'i don yin pas don dam pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du don dam pa'i bden pa zhes bya ba ni ye shes dam pa'i don yin pas don dam pa'o //
translated: Likewise, that which is called ultimate truth is the ultimate object of supreme knowledge.

original: de ni don dam pa yang yin la de ni bden pa yang yin pas don dam pa'i bden pa'o //
analyzed: de ni don dam pa yang yin la de ni bden pa yang yin pas don dam pa'i bden pa'o //
translated: It is the ultimate and it is truth, thus it is the ultimate truth.

original: ji ltar gzhan 'jig rten pas 'dzin pa de ltar ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa yin te /
analyzed: ji ltar gzhan 'jig rten pas 'dzin pa de ltar ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa yin te /
translated: It is conventional truth in the sense that it is apprehended by the world in a way that is different from the way it is apprehended by the ƒÅryas.

original: kun rdzob kyi tha snyad dam shes pa nyon mongs pa can dang / nyon mongs pa can ma yin pas 'dzin pas na kun rdzob kyi bden pa'o //
analyzed: kun rdzob kyi tha snyad dam shes pa nyon mongs pa can dang / nyon mongs pa can ma yin pas 'dzin pas na kun rdzob kyi bden pa'o //
translated: It is conventional truth because it is apprehended by afflicted and unafflicted conventional cognition or terminology.

original: rnal 'byor spyod pa rnams kyi ltar na yod pa ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: rnal 'byor spyod pa rnams kyi ltar na yod pa ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: According to the YogƒÅcƒÅra, there are three types of existence:

original: @161a * // kun rdzob tu yod pa dang / don dam par yod pa dang / rdzas su yod pa'o //üîΩde la rdzas su ste /
analyzed: @161a * // kun rdzob tu yod pa dang / don dam par yod pa dang / rdzas su yod pa'o // de la rdzas su ste /
translated: existence as conventional, existence as ultimate, and substantial existence.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid du yod pa ni rdzas su yod pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid du yod pa ni rdzas su yod pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Substantial existence is existence by way of intrinsic character.

original: tshul gnas zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la tshul ni tshul khrims te /
analyzed: tshul gnas zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la tshul ni tshul khrims te /
translated: Abiding in ethical discipline is the cause of meditative attainment.

original: de ni 'du 'dzi med pa'i rgyu dang / rnam par mi g-yeng ba'i rgyu dang / cho ga phun sum tshogs pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: de ni 'du 'dzi med pa'i rgyu dang / rnam par mi g-yeng ba'i rgyu dang / cho ga phun sum tshogs pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: It is the cause of not being distracted, the cause of not being scattered, the cause of the perfection of ritual.

original: bden pa mthong ba dang mthun pa'i zhes bya ba ni thos pa gang zhig bden pa mthong ba la phan 'dogs pa'i thos pa de 'dzin zhing 'don par byed do //
analyzed: bden pa mthong ba dang mthun pa'i zhes bya ba ni thos pa gang zhig bden pa mthong ba la phan 'dogs pa'i thos pa de 'dzin zhing 'don par byed do //
translated: The phrase in conformity with the vision of the truths means that one retains and recites that hearing which assists the vision of the truths.

original: don nyan par byed do zhes bya ba ni de'i don mnyan pa'i sgo nas rnam par shes par byed do ;
analyzed: don nyan par byed do zhes bya ba ni de'i don mnyan pa'i sgo nas rnam par shes par byed do ;
translated: One hears the meaning means that one understands it by means of hearing its meaning.

original: ; bsams pa las byung ba ji ltar gnyi ga la dmigs pa yin pa bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: ; bsams pa las byung ba ji ltar gnyi ga la dmigs pa yin pa bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: In order to demonstrate how the reflection is focused on both, he says:

original: res 'ga' ni yi ges don 'dren par byed de /
analyzed: res 'ga' ni yi ges don 'dren par byed de /
translated: Sometimes, the meaning is drawn out by the letters.

original: ming 'di'i don ni 'di yin no zhes yi ges bsgrub pa'i ming gis don 'dren par byed do //
analyzed: ming 'di'i don ni 'di yin no zhes yi ges bsgrub pa'i ming gis don 'dren par byed do //
translated: The meaning of this name is this - the meaning is drawn out by the name which is established by the letters.

original: res 'ga' ni brjod par bya ba'i don 'di'i yi ge ni 'di'o zhes don gyis yi ge 'dren par byed de /
analyzed: res 'ga' ni brjod par bya ba'i don 'di'i yi ge ni 'di'o zhes don gyis yi ge 'dren par byed de /
translated: Sometimes, the letters are drawn out by the meaning: The letters of this expressible meaning are these.

original: ming ni 'di'i zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ming ni 'di'i zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Name is the equivalent of this.

original: yi ge zhes bya ba'i sgra 'di ni ming yin par rab tu sbyar ba yin te /
analyzed: yi ge zhes bya ba'i sgra 'di ni ming yin par rab tu sbyar ba yin te /
translated: The term syllable is applied to name.

original: mdo las kyang /
analyzed: mdo las kyang /
translated: A sutra declares:

original: don bzang po /
analyzed: don bzang po /
translated: Good meaning

original: yi ge bzang po zhes 'byung bas so //
analyzed: yi ge bzang po zhes 'byung bas so //
translated: and good syllables.

original: slob dpon gyis rtog pa 'di la ni zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /
analyzed: slob dpon gyis rtog pa 'di la ni zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /
translated: The Master says: In this theory,üîΩthe wisdom arisen from contemplation will not be achieved.

original: bsams pa las byung ba'i shes rab 'grub par mi 'gyur gyi zhes bya ba ni mtshan nyid thos pa dang bsgoms pa las byung ba'i mtshan nyid dang 'chol bar bshad kyi /
analyzed: bsams pa las byung ba'i shes rab 'grub par mi 'gyur gyi zhes bya ba ni mtshan nyid thos pa dang bsgoms pa las byung ba'i mtshan nyid dang 'chol bar bshad kyi /
translated: This is because the wisdom arisen from hearing and the wisdom arisen from meditation are explained to be mixed,

original: ma 'chol bar ni ma yin pas 'grub par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ma 'chol bar ni ma yin pas 'grub par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: but they are not achieved without being mixed.üîΩIt arises from that which is born from correct investigation by reasoning.

original: rigs pas nges par brtags pa las skyes pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rigs pas nges par brtags shing nges par dpyad pa de las skyes pa yin no //
analyzed: rigs pas nges par brtags pa las skyes pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rigs pas nges par brtags shing nges par dpyad pa de las skyes pa yin no //
translated: It arises from that which is born from correct investigation and analysis by reasoning.

original: 'du 'dzi dang mi dge ba'i rnam par rtog pa thag bsrings pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la 'du 'dzi thag bsrings pa ni gang gcig tu gnas pa nyid de /üîΩde lta bas na lus kyis bsrings pa yin no //üîΩmi dge ba'i rnam par rtog pa thag bsrings pa ni gang nyon mongs pa can gyi rnam par rtog pa spangs pas te /
analyzed: 'du 'dzi dang mi dge ba'i rnam par rtog pa thag bsrings pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la 'du 'dzi thag bsrings pa ni gang gcig tu gnas pa nyid de / de lta bas na lus kyis bsrings pa yin no // mi dge ba'i rnam par rtog pa thag bsrings pa ni gang nyon mongs pa can gyi rnam par rtog pa spangs pas te /
translated: He is far removed from distractions because he lives alone.üîΩHe is far removed from unwholesome thoughts because he has abandoned defiled thoughts.

original: de lta bas na sems kyis bsrings pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na sems kyis bsrings pa yin no //
translated: He is far removed from unwholesome thoughts because he has abandoned defiled thoughts.

original: gya nom pa ma yin pa dang / mang po ma yin pa rnyed pas yid mi bde pa ni zhes bya ba ni slob dpon gyi gzhung lugs yin te /
analyzed: gya nom pa ma yin pa dang / mang po ma yin pa rnyed pas yid mi bde pa ni zhes bya ba ni slob dpon gyi gzhung lugs yin te /
translated: He is not satisfied with the acquisition of what is not excellent or abundant according to the opinion of the master.

original: yid mi bde ba ni yid mi bde ba nyid do //üîΩdes ma mgu zhing ma rangs pa zhes @161b bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: yid mi bde ba ni yid mi bde ba nyid do // des ma mgu zhing ma rangs pa zhes @161b bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: He is not satisfied because he is dissatisfied.üîΩHe is not satisfied because he is dissatisfied.üîΩHe is not satisfied because he is dissatisfied.üîΩHe is not satisfied because he is dissatisfied.

original: gya nom pa ma yin pa 'am mang po ma yin pa'i phyir rnyed pa des yid mi bde ba ni chog mi shes pa yin no //üîΩgya nom pa'ang rung /
analyzed: gya nom pa ma yin pa 'am mang po ma yin pa'i phyir rnyed pa des yid mi bde ba ni chog mi shes pa yin no //üîΩgya nom pa'ang rung /
translated: He is not satisfied because he is dissatisfied.üîΩHe is not satisfied because he is dissatisfied.

original: mang po 'ang rung ba rnyed pa las 'dod pa ni 'dod chen can yin no //
analyzed: mang po 'ang rung ba rnyed pa las 'dod pa ni 'dod chen can yin no //
translated: The greedy are those who desire to obtain many things.

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa dag kho na yin no zhes bya ba ni chags pa ni mi dge ba'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa dag kho na yin no zhes bya ba ni chags pa ni mi dge ba'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are only in the realm of desire, because greed has the nature of nonvirtue.

original: spong ba dang bsgom pa la dga' ba nyid ni 'gog pa dang / lam la dga' ba nyid do //
analyzed: spong ba dang bsgom pa la dga' ba nyid ni 'gog pa dang / lam la dga' ba nyid do //
translated: The delight in abandoning and in cultivating is the delight in cessation and in the path.

original: de ni chog shes pa'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pas /
analyzed: de ni chog shes pa'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pas /
translated: Since this is not the nature of contentment,

original: ji ltar na 'phags pa'i rigs bzhi pa 'di yang ma chags pa'i rang bzhin yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na 'phags pa'i rigs bzhi pa 'di yang ma chags pa'i rang bzhin yin zhe na /
translated: how can this fourth noble lineage also have the nature of nonattachment?

original: de'i phyir srid pa dang / 'dod pa'i 'dod chags la rgyab kyis phyogs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir srid pa dang / 'dod pa'i 'dod chags la rgyab kyis phyogs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore he says: because of turning away from existence and from the attachment of the realm of desire.

original: srid pa la rgyab kyis phyogs pa'i phyir dang / 'dod pa'i 'dod chags la rgyab kyis phyogs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: srid pa la rgyab kyis phyogs pa'i phyir dang / 'dod pa'i 'dod chags la rgyab kyis phyogs pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because of turning away from existence and because of turning away from the attachment of the realm of desire.

original: rgyab kyis phyogs pa ni ma chags pa yin no //
analyzed: rgyab kyis phyogs pa ni ma chags pa yin no //
translated: Turning away is nonattachment.

original: rang gi tshul dang / las kyi mtha' yongs su spangs pa zhes bya ba ni rang gi tshul yongs su spangs pa dang / rang gi las kyi mtha' yongs su spangs pa ste /
analyzed: rang gi tshul dang / las kyi mtha' yongs su spangs pa zhes bya ba ni rang gi tshul yongs su spangs pa dang / rang gi las kyi mtha' yongs su spangs pa ste /
translated: Abandoning one's own way and abandoning one's own work is called abandoning one's own way and abandoning one's own work.

original: de la tshul ni gang gis 'tsho bar byed pa'i 'tsho ba 'am /
analyzed: de la tshul ni gang gis 'tsho bar byed pa'i 'tsho ba 'am /
translated: Way means the way of life by which one lives,

original: zas dang skom la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: zas dang skom la sogs pa'o //
translated: such as food and drink, etc.

original: las kyi mtha' ni zhing dang bzo la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: las kyi mtha' ni zhing dang bzo la sogs pa'o //
translated: Work means farming, crafts, etc.

original: 'byung ba dang 'jig pa de lta bu'i phyir zhes bya ba la de lta bu zhes bya ba'i sgra ni 'byung ba dang 'jig pa'i rnam par ston par byed pa yin te /

original: rnam par rtog pa dang mthun pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa zhes grag go zhes bya ba la grag ces bya ba'i sgra ni gzhan gyi gzhung lugs ston par byed pa yin no //

analyzed: de'i phyir phyogs gzhan gang dag bsam gtan dngos gzhi de dag na zhes bya ba 'di rgyas par 'god do //

analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral bas thob pa ni 'dris pa'i phyir ro //
