translated: They are each threefold because they focus on the mindstreams of self, other and both.üîΩBecause they occur in the sutras.

original: mdo las byung ba'i phyir te ji skad du zhe na /
analyzed: mdo las byung ba'i phyir te ji skad du zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: brtun pa dang shes bzhin dang dran pa dang ldan par gyur na 'jig rten la brnab sems dang yid mi bde ba rnam par spangs te /
analyzed: brtun pa dang shes bzhin dang dran pa dang ldan par gyur na 'jig rten la brnab sems dang yid mi bde ba rnam par spangs te /
translated: When one is endowed with effort, introspection and mindfulness, then covetousness and mental dissatisfaction are abandoned and

original: nang gi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas so zhes bya ba dang / phyi'i lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas so zhes bya ba snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: nang gi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas so zhes bya ba dang / phyi'i lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas so zhes bya ba snga ma bzhin no //
translated: one abides observing the internal body, the external body and the internal and external body.

original: nang dang phyi'i lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas so zhes bya ba snga ma bzhin te /
analyzed: nang dang phyi'i lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas so zhes bya ba snga ma bzhin te /
translated: He dwells contemplating internally, externally, and both internally and externally, the body as a body.

original: de ltar na re zhig lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnam pa gsum yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na re zhig lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnam pa gsum yin no //
translated: Thus, the application of mindfulness to the body is threefold.

original: tshor ba dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa la yang nang gi tshor ba la tshor ba'i rjes su lta zhing gnas so zhes bya ba rgyas par rnam pa @166b gsum gsum sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: tshor ba dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa la yang nang gi tshor ba la tshor ba'i rjes su lta zhing gnas so zhes bya ba rgyas par rnam pa @166b gsum gsum sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The application of mindfulness to feeling, etc., is also threefold, as stated in the sutra: He dwells contemplating internally, externally, and both internally and externally, feelings as feelings, mind as mind, and dharmas as dharmas.

original: sngar rags pa mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni lus ni rnam par shes pa drug gis rnam par shes par bya ba yin pa'i phyir gsum pas de sngar mthong ngo //
analyzed: sngar rags pa mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni lus ni rnam par shes pa drug gis rnam par shes par bya ba yin pa'i phyir gsum pas de sngar mthong ngo //
translated: The body is seen first because it is gross. The body is seen first by the three applications of mindfulness to the body, etc., because it is the object of the six consciousnesses.

original: tshor ba ni gnyis pas rgyu ba rags pa'i phyir de'i 'og tu de mthong ngo //
analyzed: tshor ba ni gnyis pas rgyu ba rags pa'i phyir de'i 'og tu de mthong ngo //
translated: Feeling is seen next because it is gross in its movement.

original: chos rnams ni rgyu ba phra ba'i phyir rnam par shes par dka' bas phra ba yin te /
analyzed: chos rnams ni rgyu ba phra ba'i phyir rnam par shes par dka' bas phra ba yin te /
translated: Dharmas are seen last because they are subtle, since they are difficult to cognize due to the subtlety of their movement.

original: de'i phyir de'i rnam pas ni sems sngar mthong la tha mar ni chos rnams mthong ngo //
analyzed: de'i phyir de'i rnam pas ni sems sngar mthong la tha mar ni chos rnams mthong ngo //
translated: Therefore, the mind is seen first by that, and finally the dharmas are seen.

original: de yang zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa la 'dod chags pa'o //
analyzed: de yang zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa la 'dod chags pa'o //
translated: And that means the desire for sense-desire.

original: de yang sems zhes bya ba ni tshor ba mngon par 'dod pa de'o //
analyzed: de yang sems zhes bya ba ni tshor ba mngon par 'dod pa de'o //
translated: And that means the mind, which is the feeling that is desired.

original: de yang nyon mongs pa ma spangs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni ma zhi ba de yang ngo //
analyzed: de yang nyon mongs pa ma spangs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni ma zhi ba de yang ngo //
translated: And that means the non-cessation, because the defilements are not abandoned.

original: go rims bzhin du bstan te zhes bya ba ni lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa ni gtsang bar phyin ci log pa'i gnyen por bstan to //
analyzed: go rims bzhin du bstan te zhes bya ba ni lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa ni gtsang bar phyin ci log pa'i gnyen por bstan to //
translated: They are taught in that order, respectively: the mindfulness of body is taught as the antidote to the perversion of purity.

original: tshor ba dran ba nye bar gzhag pa ni bde bar phyin ci log pa'i gnyen por te /
analyzed: tshor ba dran ba nye bar gzhag pa ni bde bar phyin ci log pa'i gnyen por te /
translated: The mindfulness of feeling is taught as the antidote to the perversion of pleasure.

original: gang ci tshor yang de ni 'dir sdug bsngal ba'o zhes 'byung bas so //
analyzed: gang ci tshor yang de ni 'dir sdug bsngal ba'o zhes 'byung bas so //
translated: Because it is said: ‚ÄúWhatever is felt here, that is suffering.‚Äù

original: sems dran pa nye bar gzhag pa ni rtag par phyin ci log pa'i gnyen por te /
analyzed: sems dran pa nye bar gzhag pa ni rtag par phyin ci log pa'i gnyen por te /
translated: The mindfulness of mind is taught as the antidote to the perversion of permanence,

original: sems ni myur du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems ni myur du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the mind is quickly changing.

original: chos dran ba nye bar gzhag pa ni bdag tu phyin ci log pa'i gnyen por bstan to //
analyzed: chos dran ba nye bar gzhag pa ni bdag tu phyin ci log pa'i gnyen por bstan to //
translated: The application of mindfulness to the dharmas is taught as the antidote to the error of self.

original: chos rnams ni ril po rnam par dbye ba'i sgo nas rang dbang med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: chos rnams ni ril po rnam par dbye ba'i sgo nas rang dbang med pa'i phyir te /
translated: Dharmas are not independent, because they are divided into wholes and parts.

original: chos rnams zhes bya'i tshig ni khams tsam du zad de /
analyzed: chos rnams zhes bya'i tshig ni khams tsam du zad de /
translated: The term ‚Äúdharmas‚Äù refers to the mere elements,

original: bdag dang bral ba'o zhes bya ba yin pas so //
analyzed: bdag dang bral ba'o zhes bya ba yin pas so //
translated: because it is said that they are devoid of self.

original: yang na de ni chos 'di dag ni so so logs shig na gnas pa yin gyi 'di la bdag ni 'ga' yang med do zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang na de ni chos 'di dag ni so so logs shig na gnas pa yin gyi 'di la bdag ni 'ga' yang med do zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Or, it is taught in order to show that these dharmas exist separately, but that there is no self at all.

original: bzhi pa ni gnyi ga yin zhes bya ba ni chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa ni lus dang tshor ba dang sems la ma gtogs pa'i chos la dmigs pa nyid srid pas ma 'dres shing 'dres pa ma yin pa la dmigs pa yang srid la 'dres pa
analyzed: bzhi pa ni gnyi ga yin zhes bya ba ni chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa ni lus dang tshor ba dang sems la ma gtogs pa'i chos la dmigs pa nyid srid pas ma 'dres shing 'dres pa ma yin pa la dmigs pa yang srid la 'dres pa
translated: The fourth is both, because the application of mindfulness to the dharmas is unmixed and has a focal object that is mixed, because it is possible that it has a focal object that is not mixed, that is, dharmas that are not included in the body, feelings, mind, and dharmas.

original: la dmigs pa yang srid do //
analyzed: la dmigs pa yang srid do //
translated: It is possible that it has a focal object that is mixed,üîΩthat is, the body and so on.

original: lus la sogs pa gnyis sam gsum mam bzhi po spyi la lta na zhes bya ba ni gal te 'dres pa la dmigs pa de lus dang tshor ba gnyis la lta na yang chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa yin la /üîΩci ste lus nas sems kyi bar la lta na de yang kho na dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: lus la sogs pa gnyis sam gsum mam bzhi po spyi la lta na zhes bya ba ni gal te 'dres pa la dmigs pa de lus dang tshor ba gnyis la lta na yang chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa yin la / ci ste lus nas sems kyi bar la lta na de yang kho na dang 'dra'o //
translated: If one observes the body and feeling, it is the application of mindfulness to the dharmas.

original: 'on te lus dang tshor ba dang sems par chos rnams spyi la lta na de yang chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'on te lus dang tshor ba dang sems par chos rnams spyi la lta na de yang chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa zhes bya'o //
translated: If one observes the body, feeling, thought, and dharmas in general, it is also called the application of mindfulness to the dharmas.

original: spyi la dmigs pa la gnas te zhes bya ba ni lus @167a * //
analyzed: spyi la dmigs pa la gnas te zhes bya ba ni lus @167a * //
translated: Abiding in the observation of the general characteristics of the body, etc.

original: dang tshor ba dang sems dang chos rnams spyir bsdus te'o //
analyzed: dang tshor ba dang sems dang chos rnams spyir bsdus te'o //
translated: means that one includes the body, feeling, thought, and dharmas in general.

original: dro bar gyur pa zhes bya ba ni dro ba'i rnam pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba'o //
analyzed: dro bar gyur pa zhes bya ba ni dro ba'i rnam pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba'o //
translated: The stage of heat is the root of merit that has the aspect of heat.

original: snga ltas yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni dang po'i mtshan ma yin pa'i phyir ram dang po'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snga ltas yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni dang po'i mtshan ma yin pa'i phyir ram dang po'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is a precursor, means that it is the sign of the first stage, or it is the essence of the first stage.

original: rgyun chags pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni rgyun 'brel pa yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rgyun chags pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni rgyun 'brel pa yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Because they are continuous means because they are connected in a continuum.üîΩThe distinctions among these will be explained below.

original: 'di dag gi bye brag ni 'og nas bshad par bya'o zhes bya ba ni mdzod kyi gnas bdun pa nas /
analyzed: 'di dag gi bye brag ni 'og nas bshad par bya'o zhes bya ba ni mdzod kyi gnas bdun pa nas /
translated: The seventh chapter of the Abhidharmako≈õa states,

original: rdzas su rnam pa bcu drug go zhes bya ba 'di nas so //
analyzed: rdzas su rnam pa bcu drug go zhes bya ba 'di nas so //
translated: ‚ÄúIn substance, there are sixteen.‚ÄùüîΩIf that is similar to those, then why is it taught?

original: gal te de yang de dang 'dra na go 'o na  ci'i phyir bstan zhe na de'i phyir ches mchog tu gyur pa'i phyir ming gzhan du btags so zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: gal te de yang de dang 'dra na go 'o na  ci'i phyir bstan zhe na de'i phyir ches mchog tu gyur pa'i phyir ming gzhan du btags so zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore it is said, ‚ÄúIt is designated by a different name because it is supreme.‚Äù

original: yang ci'i phyir rtse mo zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir rtse mo zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Why is it called the summit?

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba g-yo ba'i rtse mo yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba g-yo ba'i rtse mo yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: It is said, ‚ÄúBecause it is the summit of wavering roots of virtue.‚Äù

original: rtse mo zhes bya ba'i sgra 'di ni rab kyi mtha' ston pa yin te /
analyzed: rtse mo zhes bya ba'i sgra 'di ni rab kyi mtha' ston pa yin te /
translated: The term summit indicates the highest degree.

original: 'di ltar 'jig rten na yang 'di dpal gyi rtse mor phyin to zhes zer ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'jig rten na yang 'di dpal gyi rtse mor phyin to zhes zer ro //
translated: For example, in the world, it is said, ‚ÄúHe has reached the summit of glory.‚Äù

original: dro bar gyur pa dang rtse mo'i mtshan nyid kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba gnyis ni g-yo ba yin te /
analyzed: dro bar gyur pa dang rtse mo'i mtshan nyid kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba gnyis ni g-yo ba yin te /
translated: The two roots of virtue that have the characteristics of heat and summits are wavering.

original: yongs su nyams pa srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yongs su nyams pa srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is possible to fall away from them.

original: bzod pa dang 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi mchog gi mtshan nyid gnyis ni mi g-yo ba ste /
analyzed: bzod pa dang 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi mchog gi mtshan nyid gnyis ni mi g-yo ba ste /
translated: The two that have the characteristics of receptivity and the supreme mundane state are unwavering.

original: bzlog pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bzlog pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are the opposite of that.

original: de la g-yo ba dag las chung ngu gang yin pa de ni dro bar gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: de la g-yo ba dag las chung ngu gang yin pa de ni dro bar gyur pa yin no //
translated: Among them, the lesser of the wavering ones is heat.

original: chen po gang yin pa de dag ni rtse mo yin no //
analyzed: chen po gang yin pa de dag ni rtse mo yin no //
translated: The greater of the wavering ones is summits.

original: mi g-yo ba dag las kyang chung ngu gang yin pa de ni bzod pa yin no //
analyzed: mi g-yo ba dag las kyang chung ngu gang yin pa de ni bzod pa yin no //
translated: Among the unwavering ones, the lesser ones are receptivity.

original: chen po gang yin pa de dag ni 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi mchog yin no //
analyzed: chen po gang yin pa de dag ni 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi mchog yin no //
translated: The greater ones are the supreme mundane state.

original: de dag las ltung ba'am 'da' bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la rtse mo dag las ltung ba ni yongs su nyams pa'o //
analyzed: de dag las ltung ba'am 'da' bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la rtse mo dag las ltung ba ni yongs su nyams pa'o //
translated: Because one can fall away or pass beyond them. Falling away from summits is complete degeneration.

original: 'da' ba ni bzod pa mngon du 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: 'da' ba ni bzod pa mngon du 'gyur ba ste /
translated: Passing beyond them is the manifestation of receptivity.

original: rtse mo dag ni g-yo ba yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩ'jig rten na yang shing gi rtse mo nas ltung ba'am 'da' ba ste /
analyzed: rtse mo dag ni g-yo ba yin pa'i phyir ro // 'jig rten na yang shing gi rtse mo nas ltung ba'am 'da' ba ste /
translated: because the summits are wavering.üîΩIn the world, one sees that a tree falls or passes away from the summit;

original: gong du phyin par 'gyur ba mthong bas rtse mo dang chos mthun no //üîΩdang po nyid du bden pa rnams la rnam pa dag 'god pa'o zhes bya ba ni thog mar bden pa rnams la mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa dag gtod par byed pa ste /
analyzed: gong du phyin par 'gyur ba mthong bas rtse mo dang chos mthun no // dang po nyid du bden pa rnams la rnam pa dag 'god pa'o zhes bya ba ni thog mar bden pa rnams la mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa dag gtod par byed pa ste /
translated: the summit is similar to the summit of a tree.üîΩThe first is the placement of the aspects on the truths: first, one places the aspects of the truths, impermanence, etc.

original: de dag la dmigs pa rnams 'jug par byed pa'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de dag la dmigs pa rnams 'jug par byed pa'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: , on the truths; one causes the aspects to engage their objects.

original: gzhan dag gis kyang zhes bya ba ni chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa ma yin pa dag gis kyang zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gzhan dag gis kyang zhes bya ba ni chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa ma yin pa dag gis kyang zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: By others also: by the applications of mindfulness of factors, etc.

original: @167b 'phel bar byed pa ni goms par byang bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: @167b 'phel bar byed pa ni goms par byang bar byed pa'o //
translated: One causes them to increase: one causes them to grow through cultivation.

original: rnam par 'phel bar byed pa na zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni rnam par 'phel bar byed pa'i rnal 'byor pa ni 'phel bas khyad par can du gyur pa rnams mngon sum du byed do //
analyzed: rnam par 'phel bar byed pa na zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni rnam par 'phel bar byed pa'i rnal 'byor pa ni 'phel bas khyad par can du gyur pa rnams mngon sum du byed do //
translated: When one is cultivating the increase of heat, one manifests the superior states that are increased.

original: sngon thob pa rnams zhes bya ba ni khyad par can ma yin pa dag ni mngon sum du mi byed do //
analyzed: sngon thob pa rnams zhes bya ba ni khyad par can ma yin pa dag ni mngon sum du mi byed do //
translated: One does not manifest the former states that are not superior.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: dga' ba chen po med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: dga' ba chen po med pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because there is no great joy.

original: dman pa nyid kyis dga' ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dman pa nyid kyis dga' ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is: because there is no joy due to inferiority.üîΩBecause one is greatly patient with the truths.

original: bden pa la cher bzod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni dro bar gyur pa'i gnas skabs na ni bden pa la chung ngu bzod cing 'dod do //
analyzed: bden pa la cher bzod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni dro bar gyur pa'i gnas skabs na ni bden pa la chung ngu bzod cing 'dod do //
translated: In the state of heat, one is patient with and desires the truths in a small way.

original: rtse mo'i gnas skabs na ni 'bring du'o //
analyzed: rtse mo'i gnas skabs na ni 'bring du'o //
translated: In the state of summits, one is patient with and desires the truths in a medium way.

original: de'i rjes la ni bden pa la cher bzod pa'i phyir bzod pa skye'o //
analyzed: de'i rjes la ni bden pa la cher bzod pa'i phyir bzod pa skye'o //
translated: After that, patience arises because one is greatly patient with the truths.

original: ji ltar shes she na /
analyzed: ji ltar shes she na /
translated: How does one know this?

original: de'i phyir yongs su mi nyams pa'i sgo nas zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir yongs su mi nyams pa'i sgo nas zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, it says, ‚Äúin terms of not falling away completely.‚Äù

original: 'di ltar bzod pa las yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar bzod pa las yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur gyi /
translated: Thus, one does not fall away completely from the stage of patience,

original: rtse mo dag las ni yongs su nyams pa zhes bya ba srid pa yod do //
analyzed: rtse mo dag las ni yongs su nyams pa zhes bya ba srid pa yod do //
translated: but it is possible to fall away completely from the stages of the summit.üîΩThe small and medium patience are like the summitüîΩbecause they are directed to the same reality.

original: rnam pa gnyis de bzhin zhes bya ba ni rtse mo rnams ji skad bshad pa ltar bzod pa chung ngu dang 'bring dag kyang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis de bzhin zhes bya ba ni rtse mo rnams ji skad bshad pa ltar bzod pa chung ngu dang 'bring dag kyang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: The small and medium patience are like the summit because they are directed to the same reality.

original: de kho na bzhin du rnam pa gtod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'i bden pa rnams la rnam pa dag gtod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de kho na bzhin du rnam pa gtod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'i bden pa rnams la rnam pa dag gtod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the four truths are directed to the same reality in the close placement of mindfulness of dharmas.

original: bzod pa ni thams cad ces bya ba ni bzod pa ni chung ngu dang 'bring dang / chen po'i bye brag gis tha dad pa thams cad chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa kho nas 'phel bar byed kyi lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa gzhan gyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bzod pa ni thams cad ces bya ba ni bzod pa ni chung ngu dang 'bring dang / chen po'i bye brag gis tha dad pa thams cad chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa kho nas 'phel bar byed kyi lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa gzhan gyis ni ma yin no //
translated: Patience is differentiated as small, medium, and great. All of it is enhanced by the application of the mindfulness of dharmas alone, not by the others such as the application of the mindfulness of the body.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: chos kyi mchog dang nye ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: chos kyi mchog dang nye ba'i phyir te /
translated: Because it is close to the supreme mundane state.

original: chos kyi mchog ni mthong ba'i lam dang nye bas chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'i bdag nyid kho na yin no //
analyzed: chos kyi mchog ni mthong ba'i lam dang nye bas chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'i bdag nyid kho na yin no //
translated: The supreme mundane state is the application of the mindfulness of dharmas alone, because it is close to the path of seeing.

original: chos kyi mchog dang nye ba'i phyir //
analyzed: chos kyi mchog dang nye ba'i phyir //
translated: Because it is close to the supreme mundane state.

original: zhes bya ba ni bzod pa ni rtse mo'i mjug thogs su skye ba'i phyir chos kyi mchog 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sdug bsngal gyi bden pa la dmigs pa rnams dang nye bas 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sdug bsngal gyi bden pa la dmigs pa nyid yin te
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bzod pa ni rtse mo'i mjug thogs su skye ba'i phyir chos kyi mchog 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sdug bsngal gyi bden pa la dmigs pa rnams dang nye bas 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sdug bsngal gyi bden pa la dmigs pa nyid yin te
translated: Patience is close to the supreme mundane state because it arises immediately after the peak. It is the application of the mindfulness of the truth of suffering that focuses on the truth of suffering that is to be abandoned by the path of seeing in the desire realm.

original: / chos kyi mchog dang nye ba'i phyir de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: / chos kyi mchog dang nye ba'i phyir de dang 'dra'o //
translated: because they are close to the supreme mundane state.

original: nges pa ma smos pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni dro bar gyur pa la sogs pa'i dmigs pa ni bzod pa chen po bzhin du so sor nges pa ma smos pa'i phyir bzod pa chen po bzhin nges par gzung ba kho nas dro bar gyur pa la sogs
analyzed: nges pa ma smos pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni dro bar gyur pa la sogs pa'i dmigs pa ni bzod pa chen po bzhin du so sor nges pa ma smos pa'i phyir bzod pa chen po bzhin nges par gzung ba kho nas dro bar gyur pa la sogs
translated: Because their object is not specified, like the supreme mundane state, the object of heat and so on is not specified like the object of the supreme mundane state.

original: @168a * // pa de dag ni khams gsum pa'i sdug bsngal la sogs pa la dmigs pa nyid du grub po //
analyzed: @168a * // pa de dag ni khams gsum pa'i sdug bsngal la sogs pa la dmigs pa nyid du grub po //
translated: They are ascertained to be the truth of suffering of the three realms.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: 'di la yul 'dod par gtogs pa kho na'i sdug bsngal yod pas de ni 'dod par gtogs pa'i sdug bsngal gyi yul can yin te /
analyzed: 'di la yul 'dod par gtogs pa kho na'i sdug bsngal yod pas de ni 'dod par gtogs pa'i sdug bsngal gyi yul can yin te /
translated: Because there is only suffering belonging to the desire realm in this world, it is the object of the suffering belonging to the desire realm.

original: bzod pa chen po yin no //
analyzed: bzod pa chen po yin no //
translated: It is the supreme patience.

original: bzod pa chen po kho na'o zhes nges par gzung ba'i phyir dro bar gyur pa la sogs pa gzhan ni khams gsum pa'i sdug bsngal gyi bden pa la dmigs pa yin no zhes bya bar grub po //
analyzed: bzod pa chen po kho na'o zhes nges par gzung ba'i phyir dro bar gyur pa la sogs pa gzhan ni khams gsum pa'i sdug bsngal gyi bden pa la dmigs pa yin no zhes bya bar grub po //
translated: Because it is ascertained that it is only the supreme patience, it is established that the others, heat and so on, have the truth of suffering of the three realms as their object.

original: gang gi tshe zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni gang gi tshe gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i gnyen po la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i 'gog pa dang / kun 'byung ba dang /üîΩsdug bsngal rnams dang 'dod pa na spyod pa'i gnyen po la sogs pa bsdu'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshe zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni gang gi tshe gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i gnyen po la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i 'gog pa dang / kun 'byung ba dang / sdug bsngal rnams dang 'dod pa na spyod pa'i gnyen po la sogs pa bsdu'o //
translated: When one reduces the aspects and focal objects of the truths,

original: bden pa'i rnam pa dmigs pa re re nas phri nas zhes bya ba ni bden pa'i rnam pa re re dang bden pa'i dmigs pa re re nas phri nas gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i rnam pa 'bri ba nas bzung ste /
analyzed: bden pa'i rnam pa dmigs pa re re nas phri nas zhes bya ba ni bden pa'i rnam pa re re dang bden pa'i dmigs pa re re nas phri nas gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i rnam pa 'bri ba nas bzung ste /
translated: from the time one reduces the aspects and focal objects of the truths, from reducing the aspects and focal objects of the truths of form and formlessness,

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sdug bsngal kho na la skad cig ma gnyis su yid la byed pa'i bar de thams cad ni bzod pa 'bring yin no //
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sdug bsngal kho na la skad cig ma gnyis su yid la byed pa'i bar de thams cad ni bzod pa 'bring yin no //
translated: up to the time one focuses on the two moments of the truth of suffering of the desire realm, that is medium patience.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: re zhig rjes su shes pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa'i lam la lam dang / rigs pa dang / sgrub pa dang / nges par 'byin pa ste /
analyzed: re zhig rjes su shes pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa'i lam la lam dang / rigs pa dang / sgrub pa dang / nges par 'byin pa ste /
translated: First, the path that is the aspect of subsequent knowledge focuses on the truth of path in the desire realm and projects its aspects by means of four aspects:üîΩpath,

original: rnam pa bzhi po 'di dag gis rnam pa gtod par byed do //
analyzed: rnam pa bzhi po 'di dag gis rnam pa gtod par byed do //
translated: correct method,üîΩaccomplishment and definite release.

original: de'i 'og tu gcig por nas gsum gyis so //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu gcig por nas gsum gyis so //
translated: Then it projects aspects by means of three aspects.

original: de'i 'og tu gnyis por nas gnyis kyis so //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu gnyis por nas gnyis kyis so //
translated: Then it projects aspects by means of two aspects.

original: de'i 'og tu gcig gis so //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu gcig gis so //
translated: Then it projects aspects by means of one aspect.

original: de nas lam bor nas gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i 'gog pa la rang gi rnam pa bzhis rnam pa gtod par byed de /
analyzed: de nas lam bor nas gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i 'gog pa la rang gi rnam pa bzhis rnam pa gtod par byed de /
translated: Then it abandons the path and projects aspects by means of its four aspects onto the cessation of form and formless states.üîΩThen it projects aspects by means of three, two and one aspect alone.

original: de'i 'og tu gsum dang gnyis dang gcig kho nas rnam pa gtad nas 'gog pa'i bden pa de yang bor te kun 'byung ba'i bden pa la rang gi rnam pa bzhi dang gsum dang gnyis dang gcig gis rnam pa gtad nas de kho na bzhin du de yang
analyzed: de'i 'og tu gsum dang gnyis dang gcig kho nas rnam pa gtad nas 'gog pa'i bden pa de yang bor te kun 'byung ba'i bden pa la rang gi rnam pa bzhi dang gsum dang gnyis dang gcig gis rnam pa gtad nas de kho na bzhin du de yang
translated: Then it abandons the truth of cessation and projects aspects by means of its four aspects, three aspects, two aspects and one aspect onto the truth of origin.

original: bor te sdug bsngal gyi bden pa la rang gi rnam pa bzhi nas gcig gi bar gyis rnam pa gtad nas bden pa de yang bor te /
analyzed: bor te sdug bsngal gyi bden pa la rang gi rnam pa bzhi nas gcig gi bar gyis rnam pa gtad nas bden pa de yang bor te /
translated: Having discarded that, he focuses his attention on the truth of suffering with one of his own aspects, up to four aspects, and then discards that truth.

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i gnyen po la rang gi rnam pa bzhi dang gsum dang gnyis dang gcig gis rnam pa gtod par byed do //
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i gnyen po la rang gi rnam pa bzhi dang gsum dang gnyis dang gcig gis rnam pa gtod par byed do //
translated: He focuses his attention on the antidote to the desire realm with three of his own aspects, two of his own aspects, and one of his own aspects.üîΩHaving discarded that, he focuses his attention on the truth of cessation and the truth of origin in the desire realm in the same way, reducing the number of his own aspects, and then discards those truths.

original: de yang bor te 'dod pa na spyod pa'i @168b 'gog pa dang / kun 'byung ba'i bden pa dag la de kho na bzhin du rang gi rnam pa 'bri ba'i rim pas rnam pa gtod pa dang dor bar byas nas 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sdug bsngal gyi bden pa la rnam pa bzhis rnam par gtod par byed do //
analyzed: de yang bor te 'dod pa na spyod pa'i @168b 'gog pa dang / kun 'byung ba'i bden pa dag la de kho na bzhin du rang gi rnam pa 'bri ba'i rim pas rnam pa gtod pa dang dor bar byas nas 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sdug bsngal gyi bden pa la rnam pa bzhis rnam par gtod par byed do //
translated: He focuses his attention on the truth of suffering in the desire realm with four of his own aspects.

original: de'i 'og tu gsum gyis so //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu gsum gyis so //
translated: After that, he focuses his attention with three of his own aspects.

original: de'i 'og tu gnyis kyis rnam pa gtod par byed do /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu gnyis kyis rnam pa gtod par byed do /
translated: After that, he focuses his attention with two of his own aspects.

original: de ltar na dang po 'bri ba nas bzung ste /
analyzed: de ltar na dang po 'bri ba nas bzung ste /
translated: Thus, beginning with the reduction of aspects,

original: skad cig ma de thams cad bzod pa 'bring yin no zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: skad cig ma de thams cad bzod pa 'bring yin no zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: all those moments are medium patience.

original: de la dmigs pa nyid skad cig ma gsum pa la ni bzod pa chen po yin no //
analyzed: de la dmigs pa nyid skad cig ma gsum pa la ni bzod pa chen po yin no //
translated: The third moment of the same object is the supreme mundane state.

original: de la dmigs pa nyid bzhi pa la ni chos kyi mchog yin no //
analyzed: de la dmigs pa nyid bzhi pa la ni chos kyi mchog yin no //
translated: The fourth moment of the same object is the highest mundane state.

original: bzod pa chung ngu ni gang sngar rtse mo dag gi mjug thogs su 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sdug bsngal gyi bden pa nas lam gyi bden pa'i bar dang / gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa la rang rang gi rnam pa thams cad kyis mi dbri bar yid la byed pa yin par khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: bzod pa chung ngu ni gang sngar rtse mo dag gi mjug thogs su 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sdug bsngal gyi bden pa nas lam gyi bden pa'i bar dang / gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa la rang rang gi rnam pa thams cad kyis mi dbri bar yid la byed pa yin par khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: The lesser patience is the attention that does not reduce the aspects and objects of the truth of suffering in the desire realm, up to the truth of the path, and the attention that does not reduce the aspects and objects of the truths in the form and formless realms, immediately after the peak.

original: de ltar re zhig kha cig ni dmigs pa dbri ba rnam pa dbri ba sngon du 'gro ba can yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de ltar re zhig kha cig ni dmigs pa dbri ba rnam pa dbri ba sngon du 'gro ba can yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Thus, some say that reducing the object is preceded by reducing the aspects.

original: gzhan dag na re dmigs pa rnam pa re re nas phri nas zhes bya ba ni de ltar bden pa'i rnam pa re re nas phri ba dang dmigs pa re re nas phri nas zhes bya ba ni gzung bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re dmigs pa rnam pa re re nas phri nas zhes bya ba ni de ltar bden pa'i rnam pa re re nas phri ba dang dmigs pa re re nas phri nas zhes bya ba ni gzung bar mi bya'o //
translated: Others say that reducing the object and aspects one by one should not be taken to mean reducing the aspects of the truths one by one and reducing the objects one by one.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What then?

original: gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i gnyen po la sogs pa bden pa re re'i rnam pa gang dag yin pa de dag dmigs pa phri nas zhes bya bar bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i gnyen po la sogs pa bden pa re re'i rnam pa gang dag yin pa de dag dmigs pa phri nas zhes bya bar bshad par bya'o //
translated: The aspects of each truth, such as the counteraction of the form realm and the formless realm, are reduced, that is, eliminated, as the object.

original: bzod pa 'bring ni skad cig ma brgya rtsa bcu dgu yin par brjod na dmigs pa 'bri ba rnam pa 'bri ba sngon du 'gro ba can yin na ni sems kyi skad cig ma mang por 'phro bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bzod pa 'bring ni skad cig ma brgya rtsa bcu dgu yin par brjod na dmigs pa 'bri ba rnam pa 'bri ba sngon du 'gro ba can yin na ni sems kyi skad cig ma mang por 'phro bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If the medium patience is said to have one hundred and nineteen moments, and if the reduction of the object is preceded by the reduction of the aspects, then the moments of mind would be extended.

original: de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: That is illogical.

original: bden pa dag yod bzhin du rnam pa 'dor bar ni rung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: bden pa dag yod bzhin du rnam pa 'dor bar ni rung ba ma yin no //
translated: It is not tenable that the aspects are eliminated while the truths exist.

original: gang gi tshe bden pa dag por bar gyur ba de'i tshe ni rnam pa 'dor ro zhes bya bar rigs so //
analyzed: gang gi tshe bden pa dag por bar gyur ba de'i tshe ni rnam pa 'dor ro zhes bya bar rigs so //
translated: It is logical to say that when the truths are eliminated, the aspects are eliminated.

original: de lta yin na sngar ni bden pa'i dmigs pa 'bri bar byed la phyis ni rnam pa 'bri bar byed de /
analyzed: de lta yin na sngar ni bden pa'i dmigs pa 'bri bar byed la phyis ni rnam pa 'bri bar byed de /
translated: If that is so, then previously the object of the truths is reduced and later the aspects are reduced.

original: yul gyi gzhi ni bor na de la dmigs pa 'dor bar rigs so //
analyzed: yul gyi gzhi ni bor na de la dmigs pa 'dor bar rigs so //
translated: When the basis of the object is abandoned, it is logical that the object is abandoned.

original: sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung ba dang 'gog pa dang lam dag ni mnyam par bzhag pa dang mnyam par ma bzhag pa ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung ba dang 'gog pa dang lam dag ni mnyam par bzhag pa dang mnyam par ma bzhag pa ste /
translated: Suffering, origin, cessation, and path are respectively the four aspects of the truths of suffering, origin, cessation, and path.

original: brgyad du rnam par gzhag la /
analyzed: brgyad du rnam par gzhag la /
translated: They are established as eight,

original: de dag gi rnam pa sum cu rtsa gnyis yin no zhes zer ro //üîΩda ni rigs pa gzhan 'di nye bar bstan @169a * //
analyzed: de dag gi rnam pa sum cu rtsa gnyis yin no zhes zer ro // da ni rigs pa gzhan 'di nye bar bstan @169a * //
translated: and they have thirty-two aspects.

original: par bya ste /
analyzed: par bya ste /
translated: Now, this other reasoning should be presented.

original: ji ltar byas pas she na /üîΩgang gi tshe 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sdug bsngal la rnam pa bzhis yid la byed pa nas de bzhin du gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa rnams kyi gnyen po la rnam pa bzhis yid la byed pa'i bar 'di ni bzod pa chung ngu yin no
analyzed: ji ltar byas pas she na / gang gi tshe 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sdug bsngal la rnam pa bzhis yid la byed pa nas de bzhin du gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa rnams kyi gnyen po la rnam pa bzhis yid la byed pa'i bar 'di ni bzod pa chung ngu yin no
translated: How is it done?üîΩWhen one mentally attends to the desire realm in four aspects, and similarly, up to when one mentally attends to the antidote to the suffering of the form and formless realms in four aspects, this is lesser acceptance.

original: // gang gi tshe gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa rnams kyi gnyen po bor te /
analyzed: // gang gi tshe gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa rnams kyi gnyen po bor te /
translated: When one discards the antidote to the suffering of the form and formless realms, and mentally attends to the desire realm in four aspects, this is middling acceptance.

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sdug bsngal la rnam pa bzhis yid la byed pa nas de bzhin du 'dod pa na spyod pa'i 'du byed rnams kyi gnyen po'i bar la rnam pa bzhis yid la byed pa de nas bzung ste /
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sdug bsngal la rnam pa bzhis yid la byed pa nas de bzhin du 'dod pa na spyod pa'i 'du byed rnams kyi gnyen po'i bar la rnam pa bzhis yid la byed pa de nas bzung ste /
translated: The beginning of medium patience is from the time one attends to the four aspects of the truth of suffering of the desire realm up to the time one attends to the four aspects of the antidote to the formative forces of the desire realm.

original: bzod pa 'bring brtsams pa yin no //
analyzed: bzod pa 'bring brtsams pa yin no //
translated: From that point on, one begins medium patience.

original: de la gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i gnyen po bor nas sems kyi skad cig ma nyi shu rtsa brgyad yin no //
analyzed: de la gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i gnyen po bor nas sems kyi skad cig ma nyi shu rtsa brgyad yin no //
translated: In that, one discards the antidote to the truth of suffering of the form and formless realms, and there are twenty-eight moments of mind.

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i 'du byed kyi gnyen po bor na nyi shu rtsa bzhi'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i 'du byed kyi gnyen po bor na nyi shu rtsa bzhi'o //
translated: If one discards the antidote to the formative forces of the desire realm, there are twenty-four.

original: gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i 'du byed kyi 'gog pa bor na nyi shu'o //
analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i 'du byed kyi 'gog pa bor na nyi shu'o //
translated: If one discards the cessation of the formative forces of the form and formless realms, there are twenty.

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i 'gog pa bor na bcu drug go //
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i 'gog pa bor na bcu drug go //
translated: If one discards the cessation of the desire realm, there are sixteen.

original: gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i kun 'byung ba bor na bcu gnyis so //
analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i kun 'byung ba bor na bcu gnyis so //
translated: If one discards the origin of the form and formless realms, there are twelve.

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i kun 'byung ba bor na brgyad do //
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i kun 'byung ba bor na brgyad do //
translated: If one discards the origin of the desire realm, there are eight.

original: gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i sdug bsngal bor na bzhi ste /
analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i sdug bsngal bor na bzhi ste /
translated: When the suffering of the realm of desire is abandoned, there are four aspects.

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sdug bsngal rnam pa bzhis yid la byed pas de dag ni 'di'i rnam pa bzhi yin no //
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sdug bsngal rnam pa bzhis yid la byed pas de dag ni 'di'i rnam pa bzhi yin no //
translated: When the suffering of the realm of form and the formless realm is abandoned, there are four aspects.

original: rnal 'byor spyod pa de yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: rnal 'byor spyod pa de yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The spiritual practitioner is of two kinds:

original: lta ba spyad pa dang / sred pa spyad pa'o //
analyzed: lta ba spyad pa dang / sred pa spyad pa'o //
translated: one who practices view and one who practices craving.

original: lta ba spyad pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: lta ba spyad pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: One who practices view is of two kinds:

original: bdag tu lta ba spyad pa dang / bdag gir lta ba spyad pa'o //
analyzed: bdag tu lta ba spyad pa dang / bdag gir lta ba spyad pa'o //
translated: one who practices the view of self and one who practices the view of mine.

original: de la bdag tu lta ba spyad pa gang yin pa de ni bdag med pa'i rnam pas nges pa la 'jug go //
analyzed: de la bdag tu lta ba spyad pa gang yin pa de ni bdag med pa'i rnam pas nges pa la 'jug go //
translated: One who practices the view of self enters into ascertainment by way of the aspect of selflessness.

original: bdag gir lta ba spyad pa gang yin pa de ni stong pa'i rnam pas so //
analyzed: bdag gir lta ba spyad pa gang yin pa de ni stong pa'i rnam pas so //
translated: One who practices the view of mine enters into ascertainment by way of the aspect of emptiness.

original: sred pa spyad pa yang rnam pa gnyis te nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal gyis nyams pa dang / le lo lhag pa can no //
analyzed: sred pa spyad pa yang rnam pa gnyis te nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal gyis nyams pa dang / le lo lhag pa can no //
translated: One who practices craving is of two kinds: one who is impaired by pride thinking ‚ÄúI am‚Äù and one who is impaired by laziness.

original: de la nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal gyis nyams pa gang yin pa de ni mi rtag pa'i rnam pas nges pa la 'jug go ;
analyzed: de la nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal gyis nyams pa gang yin pa de ni mi rtag pa'i rnam pas nges pa la 'jug go ;
translated: The one who is weak in pride enters into ascertainment by way of the aspect of impermanence.

original: / le lo lhag pa can gang yin pa de ni sdug bsngal gyi rnam pas so //
analyzed: / le lo lhag pa can gang yin pa de ni sdug bsngal gyi rnam pas so //
translated: The one who is weak in laziness enters by way of the aspect of suffering.

original: de la rnal 'byor spyod pa bdag tu lta ba spyad pa ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sdug bsngal la rnam pa gcig bor nas rnam pa gsum gyis yid la byed do //
analyzed: de la rnal 'byor spyod pa bdag tu lta ba spyad pa ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sdug bsngal la rnam pa gcig bor nas rnam pa gsum gyis yid la byed do //
translated: The one who practices the yoga of the view of self, having abandoned one aspect of the suffering of the desire realm, attends to it with three aspects.

original: de'i 'og tu stong pa dang bdag med pa'i rnam pa gnyis kyis so //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu stong pa dang bdag med pa'i rnam pa gnyis kyis so //
translated: After that, with the two aspects of emptiness and selflessness.

original: de'i 'og tu @169b sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa dang sdug bsngal la chos shes pa dang 'dra bas bdag med pa'i rnam pa gcig pu la lan gnyis su mngon sum du byed de /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu @169b sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa dang sdug bsngal la chos shes pa dang 'dra bas bdag med pa'i rnam pa gcig pu la lan gnyis su mngon sum du byed de /
translated: After that, with the two aspects of emptiness and selflessness, like the receptivity to the knowledge of the teaching on suffering and the knowledge of the teaching on suffering.

original: de ltar na bzod pa 'bring de ni sems kyi skad cig ma brgya rtsa bcu dgu yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na bzod pa 'bring de ni sems kyi skad cig ma brgya rtsa bcu dgu yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, that medium receptivity is one hundred and nineteen moments of mind.

original: bdag gir mos pa yang de dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: bdag gir mos pa yang de dang 'dra ste /
translated: The same is true of the conviction of ‚Äúmine.‚Äù

original: de ni stong pa dang / bdag med pa'i rnam pa dag gis rnam pa gtad nas stong pa nyid kyi rnam pa lan gnyis su mngon du byed de /
analyzed: de ni stong pa dang / bdag med pa'i rnam pa dag gis rnam pa gtad nas stong pa nyid kyi rnam pa lan gnyis su mngon du byed de /
translated: It is projected by the aspects of emptiness and selflessness, and the aspect of emptiness is manifested twice.

original: de ltar na bzod pa 'bring de ni skad cig ma brgya rtsa bcu dgu yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na bzod pa 'bring de ni skad cig ma brgya rtsa bcu dgu yin no //
translated: Thus, this medium patience has one hundred and nineteen moments.

original: de bzhin du sred pa spyad pa rnam pa gnyis po nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal gyis nyams pa dang / le lo lhag pa can yang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du sred pa spyad pa rnam pa gnyis po nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal gyis nyams pa dang / le lo lhag pa can yang brjod par bya'o //
translated: So too, one should state that the two types of practitioners of craving, those who are impaired by pride thinking ‚ÄúI am‚Äù and those who are impaired by laziness, have one hundred and nineteen moments of small and medium patience.

original: bzod pa chen po ni skad cig ma gcig kho na yin te /
analyzed: bzod pa chen po ni skad cig ma gcig kho na yin te /
translated: Great patience has only one moment.

original: de ni gang zag gis ji ltar spyad pa bzhin du mi rtag pa'i rnam pa'am /
analyzed: de ni gang zag gis ji ltar spyad pa bzhin du mi rtag pa'i rnam pa'am /
translated: It is concomitant with the aspect of impermanence,

original: sdug bsngal gyi rnam pa'am /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi rnam pa'am /
translated: the aspect of suffering,

original: stong pa'i rnam pa'am /
analyzed: stong pa'i rnam pa'am /
translated: the aspect of emptiness,

original: bdag med pa'i rnam pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: bdag med pa'i rnam pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa yin no //
translated: and the aspect of selflessness, in accordance with the way the person practices.

original: yang ci'i phyir bden pa'i rnam pa dmigs pa re re nas 'bri bar byed ce na /
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir bden pa'i rnam pa dmigs pa re re nas 'bri bar byed ce na /
translated: Why does the number of aspects of the truths and focal objects decrease one by one?

original: khams gsum pa la sun 'byin par byed pa des dang por ni gnyen po mtha' dag la dmigs so //
analyzed: khams gsum pa la sun 'byin par byed pa des dang por ni gnyen po mtha' dag la dmigs so //
translated: Since it is a revulsion toward the three realms, at first it focuses on all the antidotes.

original: phyis ni 'dod pa'i khams dang por spang bar bya ba dang / yongs su shes par bya ba yin pa'i phyir 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sdug bsngal kho na la dmigs pa yin no //üîΩde'i rtsal gyis lam 'dren par byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni sngon zag pa med pa'i phyir skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu med par chos kyi mchog gi rtsal gyis lam gyi bden pa 'dren par byed pa'i phyir chos kyi mchog rnams ni 'jig rten pa kun
analyzed: phyis ni 'dod pa'i khams dang por spang bar bya ba dang / yongs su shes par bya ba yin pa'i phyir 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sdug bsngal kho na la dmigs pa yin no // de'i rtsal gyis lam 'dren par byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni sngon zag pa med pa'i phyir skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu med par chos kyi mchog gi rtsal gyis lam gyi bden pa 'dren par byed pa'i phyir chos kyi mchog rnams ni 'jig rten pa kun
translated: Later, since the desire realm is the first to be abandoned and fully understood, it focuses on just the suffering of the desire realm.üîΩSince it is the power of that which leads to the path,üîΩsince the path of seeing is not previously possessed, the path of seeing is led to by the power of the supreme mundane state.

original: gyi nang na mchog nyid yin par shes so ;
analyzed: gyi nang na mchog nyid yin par shes so ;
translated: Since it is the power of that which leads to the path, the supreme mundane state is known to be supreme among all mundane states.

original: ; thams cad phung po lnga /
analyzed: ; thams cad phung po lnga /
translated: All are the five aggregates.

original: 'khor dang bcas te smos pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni dro bar gyur pa la sogs pa mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa pa yin pa'i phyir rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid kyi gzugs kyi phung po yod pas 'khor dang bcas te smos pa'i phyir
analyzed: 'khor dang bcas te smos pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni dro bar gyur pa la sogs pa mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa pa yin pa'i phyir rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid kyi gzugs kyi phung po yod pas 'khor dang bcas te smos pa'i phyir
translated: Therefore they are mentioned together with their retinue.

original: dro bar gyur ba la sogs pa ni phung po lnga yin te /
analyzed: dro bar gyur ba la sogs pa ni phung po lnga yin te /
translated: Heat and so on are the five aggregates

original: 'khor dang bcas pa yin par gzung ngo //
analyzed: 'khor dang bcas pa yin par gzung ngo //
translated: because they are taken to be together with their retinue.üîΩIf one who obtains a result through manifesting the ƒÅrya path

original: 'phags pa la zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni 'phags pa la thob pa mngon sum du gyur pas 'bras bu thob pa na /üîΩdro bar gyur pa la sogs pa sbyor bar gyur ba rnams mngon sum du 'gyur du 'ong bas thob pa rnams ni dro bar @170a * //
analyzed: 'phags pa la zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni 'phags pa la thob pa mngon sum du gyur pas 'bras bu thob pa na / dro bar gyur pa la sogs pa sbyor bar gyur ba rnams mngon sum du 'gyur du 'ong bas thob pa rnams ni dro bar @170a * //
translated: obtains heat and so on,

original: gyur pa la sogs pas ma bsdus te /
analyzed: gyur pa la sogs pas ma bsdus te /
translated: then it is illogical that they are not included in heat and so on.

original: sbyor ba'i 'bras bu thob zin pa'i 'phags pa mngon du byed par ni rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: sbyor ba'i 'bras bu thob zin pa'i 'phags pa mngon du byed par ni rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: If one who obtains a result through manifesting the ƒÅrya path obtains heat and so on, then it is illogical that they are not included in heat and so on, because it would follow that heat and so on would manifest.

original: bden pa gsum la dmigs pa'i dro bar gyur pa rnam pa gtod pa la zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung ba dang / lam la dmigs pa'i dro bar gyur pa rnam pa gtod pa la /
analyzed: bden pa gsum la dmigs pa'i dro bar gyur pa rnam pa gtod pa la zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung ba dang / lam la dmigs pa'i dro bar gyur pa rnam pa gtod pa la /
translated: The present application of mindfulness of phenomena is the focal object of heat that is the aspect of the three truths.

original: chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa da ltar byung ba yin te /
analyzed: chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa da ltar byung ba yin te /
translated: The future is obtained in four aspects.

original: dang po 'bad pas bskyed par bya ba'i rnam pa gtod pa la ni spyi la dmigs pa nyid kyis chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa kho nas gtod par nus pa'i phyir ro //üîΩso sor nges pa la dmigs pa'i phyir lus dran ba nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pas ni mi nus so //
analyzed: dang po 'bad pas bskyed par bya ba'i rnam pa gtod pa la ni spyi la dmigs pa nyid kyis chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa kho nas gtod par nus pa'i phyir ro // so sor nges pa la dmigs pa'i phyir lus dran ba nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pas ni mi nus so //
translated: The present application of mindfulness of phenomena is the focal object of heat that is the aspect of the three truths because it is the aspect of the truth of path.

original: ma 'ongs pa ni bzhi char 'thob bo zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir dran pa nye bar gzhag pas ni lus dang tshor ba la sogs pa sdug bsngal gyi bden pa la sogs pas bsdus pa yang bsdus la /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa ni bzhi char 'thob bo zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir dran pa nye bar gzhag pas ni lus dang tshor ba la sogs pa sdug bsngal gyi bden pa la sogs pas bsdus pa yang bsdus la /
translated: The future is obtained in four aspects because the four applications of mindfulness are obtained in the future.

original: lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa yang sngar thob pa yin pa de'i phyir bzhi char yang 'thob ste /
analyzed: lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa yang sngar thob pa yin pa de'i phyir bzhi char yang 'thob ste /
translated: Also, the foundations of mindfulness of body and so on are obtained previously, therefore all four are obtained.

original: thob pa skye ba'i phyir ro //üîΩ'gog pa'i bden pa la dmigs pa la ni de kho na gnyi ga yin no zhes bya ba ni 'gog pa'i bden pa la dmigs pa'i dro bar 'gyur ba rnam pa gtod pa la ni chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa da ltar byung ba yin zhing de
analyzed: thob pa skye ba'i phyir ro // 'gog pa'i bden pa la dmigs pa la ni de kho na gnyi ga yin no zhes bya ba ni 'gog pa'i bden pa la dmigs pa'i dro bar 'gyur ba rnam pa gtod pa la ni chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa da ltar byung ba yin zhing de
translated: Because their obtainment arises.üîΩWith respect to focusing on the truth of cessation, both are just that.

original: kho na ma 'ongs pa 'thob kyi /üîΩlus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: kho na ma 'ongs pa 'thob kyi / lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa ni ma yin te /
translated: With respect to focusing on the truth of cessation, the foundation of mindfulness of phenomena is present and that alone is obtained in the future.

original: 'gog pa'i bden pa la lus la sogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gog pa'i bden pa la lus la sogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The foundation of mindfulness of body and so on are not obtained because body and so on do not exist in the truth of cessation.üîΩAll aspects are similar.

original: rnam pa dag ni thams cad du 'dra ba yin no zhes bya ba ni bden pa gsum la dmigs pa dang / 'gog pa la dmigs pa'i dro bar gyur pa'i rnam pa gtod pa la yang rnam pa dag ni 'dra ba kho na 'thob ste /
analyzed: rnam pa dag ni thams cad du 'dra ba yin no zhes bya ba ni bden pa gsum la dmigs pa dang / 'gog pa la dmigs pa'i dro bar gyur pa'i rnam pa gtod pa la yang rnam pa dag ni 'dra ba kho na 'thob ste /
translated: With respect to focusing on the three truths and focusing on cessation, all aspects are similar.

original: sdug bsngal gyi bden pa la dmigs pa la yang sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'i rnam pa bzhi kho na 'thob kyi kun 'byung ba'i bden pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi bden pa la dmigs pa la yang sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'i rnam pa bzhi kho na 'thob kyi kun 'byung ba'i bden pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Also, when focusing on the truth of suffering, one obtains only the four aspects of the truth of suffering, not the aspects of the truth of origin and so on.

original: kun 'byung ba'i bden pa la dmigs pa la yang kun 'byung ba'i bden pa'i rnam pa bzhi kho na 'thob kyi gzhan dag ni ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: kun 'byung ba'i bden pa la dmigs pa la yang kun 'byung ba'i bden pa'i rnam pa bzhi kho na 'thob kyi gzhan dag ni ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
translated: Also, when focusing on the truth of origin, one obtains only the four aspects of the truth of origin and not others.

original: bden pa gsum la dmigs pa rnam par 'phel ba la ni lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa bzhi las gang yang rung ba zhig da ltar byung ba yin no //
analyzed: bden pa gsum la dmigs pa rnam par 'phel ba la ni lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa bzhi las gang yang rung ba zhig da ltar byung ba yin no //
translated: When expanding focus on the three truths, any one of the four establishments of mindfulness of the body and so on is present.

original: 'gog pa la dmigs pa de kho na la ni tha ma da @170b ltar byung ba yin no //
analyzed: 'gog pa la dmigs pa de kho na la ni tha ma da @170b ltar byung ba yin no //
translated: When focusing on cessation alone, the last is present.

original: gnyi ga la yang ma 'ongs pa ni bzhi char ro //
analyzed: gnyi ga la yang ma 'ongs pa ni bzhi char ro //
translated: In both cases, the four are future.

original: rnam pa ni bcu drug po thams cad kyang 'thob bo //
analyzed: rnam pa ni bcu drug po thams cad kyang 'thob bo //
translated: One also obtains all sixteen aspects.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: rigs rnams thob zin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: rigs rnams thob zin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because the lineages have already been obtained.

original: ci rigs par bden pa bzhi la dmigs pa lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa'i rigs rnams thob zin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ci rigs par bden pa bzhi la dmigs pa lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa'i rigs rnams thob zin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúbecause they have already obtained the types of mindfulness of dharmas that focus on the four truths‚Äù means that they have already obtained the types of mindfulness of dharmas that focus on the four truths.

original: rtse mo bden pa bzhi la dmigs pa zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni /
analyzed: rtse mo bden pa bzhi la dmigs pa zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe peak that focuses on the four truths‚Äù is explained in detail.

original: rtse mo rnam pa gtod par byed pa la ni thams cad la yang chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa kho na da ltar byung ba yin te /
analyzed: rtse mo rnam pa gtod par byed pa la ni thams cad la yang chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa kho na da ltar byung ba yin te /
translated: In the peak that focuses on the four truths, the mindfulness of dharmas alone is present in the present.

original: lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pas ni rnam pa gtod pa mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pas ni rnam pa gtod pa mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the mindfulness of the body and so on cannot focus on the aspects of the four truths.

original: 'gog pa la dmigs pa 'phel ba yang tha ma chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa da ltar byung ba yin te /
analyzed: 'gog pa la dmigs pa 'phel ba yang tha ma chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa da ltar byung ba yin te /
translated: The increase of the peak that focuses on cessation has the mindfulness of dharmas alone in the present.

original: gzhan dag ni ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the others are not present.

original: bden pa gsum la dmigs pa rnam par 'phel ba la ni bzhi las gang yang rung ba zhig da ltar byung ba yin no //
analyzed: bden pa gsum la dmigs pa rnam par 'phel ba la ni bzhi las gang yang rung ba zhig da ltar byung ba yin no //
translated: The increase of the peak that focuses on the three truths has any of the four present.

original: thams cad du yang ma 'ongs pa ni bzhi char ro //
analyzed: thams cad du yang ma 'ongs pa ni bzhi char ro //
translated: In all cases, the future is all four.

original: de dag gi rigs thob zin pa'i phyir rnam pa yang thams cad do zhes bya bar khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag gi rigs thob zin pa'i phyir rnam pa yang thams cad do zhes bya bar khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: And in all cases, the aspect is also all, because the obtainment of the lineage has already occurred.üîΩPatience is the last in all cases.

original: bzod pa rnams ni thams cad du tha ma yin la zhes bya ba ni rnam pa gtod pa dang rnam par 'phel ba yang tha ma chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa da ltar byung ba yin te /
analyzed: bzod pa rnams ni thams cad du tha ma yin la zhes bya ba ni rnam pa gtod pa dang rnam par 'phel ba yang tha ma chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa da ltar byung ba yin te /
translated: The present close placement of mindfulness of phenomena is the last in terms of directing the aspect and increasing.

original: 'di ltar bzod pa ni thams cad chos kyis 'phel bar byed ces bshad do //
analyzed: 'di ltar bzod pa ni thams cad chos kyis 'phel bar byed ces bshad do //
translated: Thus it is explained that patience increases all phenomena.üîΩThe supreme mundane state is the last.

original: chos kyi mchog dag ni tha ma yin zhes bya ba ni chos kyi mchog dag mngon sum du byed pa la ni tha ma chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa da ltar byung ba yin no //
analyzed: chos kyi mchog dag ni tha ma yin zhes bya ba ni chos kyi mchog dag mngon sum du byed pa la ni tha ma chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa da ltar byung ba yin no //
translated: The present close placement of mindfulness of phenomena is the last in terms of manifesting the supreme mundane state.

original: ma 'ongs pa ni mi skye ba'i chos can kho na bzhi char 'thob bo /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa ni mi skye ba'i chos can kho na bzhi char 'thob bo /
translated: The future is all four, since it is not generated.

original: rnam pa bzhi kho na ste zhes bya ba ni mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa dang / bdag med pa'i bdag nyid kyi rnam pa dag go //
analyzed: rnam pa bzhi kho na ste zhes bya ba ni mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa dang / bdag med pa'i bdag nyid kyi rnam pa dag go //
translated: There are only four aspects, that is, the aspects of impermanence, the aspect of suffering, the aspect of emptiness, and the aspect of selflessness.

original: gzhan med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar chos kyi mchog la kun 'byung ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa gzhan ni med do /
analyzed: gzhan med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar chos kyi mchog la kun 'byung ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa gzhan ni med do /
translated: Because there are no other aspects, that is, because there are no other aspects such as origination in the supreme mundane state.

original: sdug bsngal tsam la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //üîΩ'o na ji ltar chos kyi mchog gi ngo bo nyid ma yin pa lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa mngon du ma gyur kyang chos kyi mchog kun du 'byung ba'i gnas skabs na /
analyzed: sdug bsngal tsam la dmigs pa'i phyir ro // 'o na ji ltar chos kyi mchog gi ngo bo nyid ma yin pa lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa mngon du ma gyur kyang chos kyi mchog kun du 'byung ba'i gnas skabs na /
translated: Because it focuses on mere suffering.üîΩIf that is so, then how is it that the foundations of mindfulness, etc., which are not of the nature of the supreme mundane state, are not manifest?

original: lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa ma 'ongs pa thob pa de bzhin du chos kyi mchog gi @171a * //
analyzed: lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa ma 'ongs pa thob pa de bzhin du chos kyi mchog gi @171a * //
translated: Just as the future foundations of mindfulness, etc., are obtained in the state of the arising of the supreme mundane state,

original: ngo bo nyid ma yin pa kun 'byung ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa kun du mi 'byung yang kun 'byung ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa ma 'ongs pa thob par go ci ste mi 'dod ce na /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid ma yin pa kun 'byung ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa kun du mi 'byung yang kun 'byung ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa ma 'ongs pa thob par go ci ste mi 'dod ce na /
translated: Why not accept that the future aspects of origination, etc. are obtained, even though the aspects of origination, etc. do not actually occur in the intrinsic reality?

original: de'i phyir mthong ba'i lam dang 'dra ba'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir mthong ba'i lam dang 'dra ba'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore it says, ‚Äúbecause it is similar to the path of seeing.‚Äù

original: sdug bsngal gyi rnam pa bzhi kho na 'thob bo //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi rnam pa bzhi kho na 'thob bo //
translated: One obtains only the four aspects of suffering.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: mthong ba'i lam dang 'dra ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam dang 'dra ba'i phyir te /
translated: Because it is similar to the path of seeing.

original: mthong ba'i lam la ni bden pa gang zhig mthong bar 'gyur ba de'i rnam pa dag kho na 'thob la /
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam la ni bden pa gang zhig mthong bar 'gyur ba de'i rnam pa dag kho na 'thob la /
translated: On the path of seeing, one obtains only the aspects of the truth that is being seen.

original: chos kyi mchog rnams kyang mthong ba'i lam dang 'dra bas so //
analyzed: chos kyi mchog rnams kyang mthong ba'i lam dang 'dra bas so //
translated: The supreme mundane state is similar to the path of seeing.

original: yang nye ba'i phyir 'di dag mthong ba'i lam dang 'dra ba ci zhig yod ce na /
analyzed: yang nye ba'i phyir 'di dag mthong ba'i lam dang 'dra ba ci zhig yod ce na /
translated: Again, how is it similar to the path of seeing because it is proximate?

original: de kho na bzhin du dang por 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sdug bsngal la dmigs pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: de kho na bzhin du dang por 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sdug bsngal la dmigs pa nyid yin no //
translated: Just as the path of seeing first focuses on the suffering of the desire realm, so too does this.

original: yang na sa mtshungs pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: yang na sa mtshungs pa nyid yin te /
translated: Or else, it is similar because it is the same level.

original: 'di ltar mthong ba'i lam gyi dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: 'di ltar mthong ba'i lam gyi dbang du byas nas /
translated: Thus, from the perspective of the path of seeing,

original: de ni chos mchog dang sa gcig ces 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ni chos mchog dang sa gcig ces 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: it is explained that the supreme mundane state and the first stage are the same.

original: yang na chos kyi mchog rnams ni so so'i skye bo nyid 'joms par byed pa sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa'i bar chad med pa'i lam lta bur gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: yang na chos kyi mchog rnams ni so so'i skye bo nyid 'joms par byed pa sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa'i bar chad med pa'i lam lta bur gyur pa yin no //
translated: Or, the supreme mundane state is like the uninterrupted path of perseverance for the knowledge of the truth of suffering that destroys the state of being an ordinary being.

original: de ltar na 'di dag ni mthong ba'i lam dang 'dra ba yin te /
analyzed: de ltar na 'di dag ni mthong ba'i lam dang 'dra ba yin te /
translated: Thus these are similar to the path of seeing,

original: bar chad med pa'i lam rnams ni rnam par grol ba'i lam dag dang 'dra bas so //
analyzed: bar chad med pa'i lam rnams ni rnam par grol ba'i lam dag dang 'dra bas so //
translated: because the uninterrupted paths are similar to the liberated paths.

original: nges par 'byed pas na zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: nges par 'byed pas na zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: The term ‚Äúpenetrating‚Äù is explained in detail.

original: ji ltar nges par 'byed pa yin zhe na /üîΩsmras pa / des the tshom spang ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: ji ltar nges par 'byed pa yin zhe na / smras pa / des the tshom spang ba'i phyir te /
translated: How is it penetrating?üîΩIt is penetrating because it abandons doubt,

original: bden pa rnams la 'di ni sdug bsngal lo zhes bya ba nas 'di ni lam mo zhes bya ba'i bar du gtan la phab nas rnam par 'byed pa'i phyir nges par 'byed pa ste /
analyzed: bden pa rnams la 'di ni sdug bsngal lo zhes bya ba nas 'di ni lam mo zhes bya ba'i bar du gtan la phab nas rnam par 'byed pa'i phyir nges par 'byed pa ste /
translated: because it penetrates the truths, determining that this is suffering and this is the path.
