analyzed: so so'i skye bo kho na de ltar gtong ngo zhes bya bar ji ltar shes she na /
translated: How do you know that only ordinary beings are relinquished in this way?üîΩBecause the treatise Attainment of Knowledge declares:

original: bstan bcos las sgo nga dang / nur nur po la sogs par gyur pa'i so so'i skye bo ni lus dang ldan gyi lus kyi las dang ni ma yin no zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bstan bcos las sgo nga dang / nur nur po la sogs par gyur pa'i so so'i skye bo ni lus dang ldan gyi lus kyi las dang ni ma yin no zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Ordinary beings who are in the state of an egg, the state of an embryo and so on possess a body but do not possess physical karma.

original: slob dpon dbyig bshes na re ni so so'i skye bo ni sa 'pho ba yang rung mi 'pho ba yang rung ste ris mthun pa kho nas gtong ngo zhes bya ba 'dir sa smos par bsam gtan mtha' dag gzung ste /üîΩde la gang gi tshe so so'i skye bo tshangs ris pa dag nas shi 'phos te /
analyzed: slob dpon dbyig bshes na re ni so so'i skye bo ni sa 'pho ba yang rung mi 'pho ba yang rung ste ris mthun pa kho nas gtong ngo zhes bya ba 'dir sa smos par bsam gtan mtha' dag gzung ste / de la gang gi tshe so so'i skye bo tshangs ris pa dag nas shi 'phos te /
translated: Here, level refers to all the absorptions.

original: tshangs pa'i mdun na 'don dag gi nang du skye ba de'i tshe ris mthun pa btang bas gtong ngo //
analyzed: tshangs pa'i mdun na 'don dag gi nang du skye ba de'i tshe ris mthun pa btang bas gtong ngo //
translated: When ordinary beings die in the class of Brahmakayika and are born in the class of Brahmapurohita, they relinquish it through obtaining a compatible level.

original: gang gi tshe bsam gtan dang po nas shi 'phos nas bsam gtan gnyis par skyes pa de'i tshe ni sa bor ba dang ris mthun pa btang ba dag gis gtong ngo zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gang gi tshe bsam gtan dang po nas shi 'phos nas bsam gtan gnyis par skyes pa de'i tshe ni sa bor ba dang ris mthun pa btang ba dag gis gtong ngo zhes zer ro //
translated: When they die in the first absorption and are born in the second absorption, they relinquish it through both abandoning the level and obtaining a compatible level.

original: de ni tshangs pa'i 'jig rten du skyes pa'i so so'i skye bo rnams la nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa med pa'i phyir rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni tshangs pa'i 'jig rten du skyes pa'i so so'i skye bo rnams la nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa med pa'i phyir rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: That is illogical because ordinary beings who are born in the world of Brahma do not possess factors conducive to penetrative insight.

original: nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa dag ni 'dod pa'i khams su skyed par byed la /
analyzed: nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa dag ni 'dod pa'i khams su skyed par byed la /
translated: Those who are definite in their lineage are born in the desire realm.

original: 'dod pa'i khams nas 'chi 'pho ba nyid kyis de dag gi nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa gtong bas so //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams nas 'chi 'pho ba nyid kyis de dag gi nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa gtong bas so //
translated: They abandon the factors conducive to penetrative insight by dying in the desire realm.

original: 'di ni slob dpon 'dus bzang gis kyang bstan te /üîΩso so'i skye bo yang sa gang ba'i nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang @173a * //
analyzed: 'di ni slob dpon 'dus bzang gis kyang bstan te / so so'i skye bo yang sa gang ba'i nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang @173a * //
translated: This is also taught by Master Samathadeva:

original: mthun pa thob pa de nas gong du skye ba'i tshe nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa dag 'dor ba ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: mthun pa thob pa de nas gong du skye ba'i tshe nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa dag 'dor ba ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: ‚ÄúWhen ordinary beings are born in a higher realm after obtaining the factors conducive to penetrative insight of that level, don‚Äôt they abandon the factors conducive to penetrative insight?‚Äù

original: de ni med de /
analyzed: de ni med de /
translated: They do not abandon them.

original: ris mthun pa btang ba kho nas bor ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ris mthun pa btang ba kho nas bor ba'i phyir ro //
translated: They abandon them by relinquishing the same type of being.

original: 'chi ba'i srid pa la gnas pas de dag 'dor bas srid pa bar ma la gnas pas bor zin te /
analyzed: 'chi ba'i srid pa la gnas pas de dag 'dor bas srid pa bar ma la gnas pas bor zin te /
translated: They abandon them by abiding in the intermediate existence after death.

original: de'i gong du skye ba na 'dor bar gyur ba gang yin pa de ni med pas 'chi ba kho nas zhes bshad do zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i gong du skye ba na 'dor bar gyur ba gang yin pa de ni med pas 'chi ba kho nas zhes bshad do zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Since there is no abandonment of those factors conducive to penetrative insight when one is born in a higher realm, it is said that they are abandoned by death alone.

original: so sor thar pa'i sdom pa bzhin du zhes bya ba ni dper na so sor thar pa'i sdom pa btang ba phyis len pa na sngon gyi ma yin pa thob pa dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: so sor thar pa'i sdom pa bzhin du zhes bya ba ni dper na so sor thar pa'i sdom pa btang ba phyis len pa na sngon gyi ma yin pa thob pa dang 'dra'o //
translated: Like the pratimoksa vows, means that, for example, when one who has relinquished the pratimoksa vows later takes them again, one obtains vows that are not the former ones.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: ma 'dris pa dang 'bad de bsgrub par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: ma 'dris pa dang 'bad de bsgrub par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: He says, because they are not familiar and because they are to be accomplished through exertion.

original: ma 'dris pa'i phyir dang / 'bad de bsgrub par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma 'dris pa'i phyir dang / 'bad de bsgrub par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are not familiar and because they are to be accomplished through exertion.

original: gong gi phyir thog ma med pa can gyi 'khor ba na 'dris pa ma yin pa'i phyir 'dod chags dang bral bas 'thob pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gong gi phyir thog ma med pa can gyi 'khor ba na 'dris pa ma yin pa'i phyir 'dod chags dang bral bas 'thob pa ma yin no //
translated: Because they are not familiar in beginningless samsara, they are not obtained through freedom from attachment.

original: gang gi phyir 'bad pas bsgrub par bya ba yin pa de'i phyir sdun  btang ba dag mi 'thob bo //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'bad pas bsgrub par bya ba yin pa de'i phyir sdun  btang ba dag mi 'thob bo //
translated: Because they are to be accomplished through exertion, they are not obtained by those who have previously relinquished them.

original: mtshams ston par byed pa zhig yod na ni zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mtshams ston par byed pa zhig yod na ni zhes bya ba la /
translated: If there is a teacher who reveals the boundaries,

original: mtshams ni bar mtshams so //
analyzed: mtshams ni bar mtshams so //
translated: boundaries are limits.

original: ston par byed pa ni ston pa po ste /
analyzed: ston par byed pa ni ston pa po ste /
translated: A teacher is one who reveals.

original: smon nas shes pa 'thob pa'o //
analyzed: smon nas shes pa 'thob pa'o //
translated: One obtains knowledge through prayer.

original: de yod na thob ste nyams pa'i gong ma skyed par byed de ma bskyed pa gang yin pa skyed par byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de yod na thob ste nyams pa'i gong ma skyed par byed de ma bskyed pa gang yin pa skyed par byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: If it exists, then it is obtained, and it generates the former that has degenerated. It generates that which has not been generated.

original: mtshams ston par byed pa med na ni bzhi kho nas skyed par byed de dro bar gyur pa nas brtsams te zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mtshams ston par byed pa med na ni bzhi kho nas skyed par byed de dro bar gyur pa nas brtsams te zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: If there is no one who indicates the boundary, then it is generated by four alone, beginning with heat.

original: rnam par nyams pa dang yongs su nyams pa 'di dag gi zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rnam par nyams pa dang yongs su nyams pa 'di dag gi zhes bya ba ni /
translated: These two, degeneration and complete degeneration,

original: 'phags pas de dag sa bor nas //
analyzed: 'phags pas de dag sa bor nas //
translated: The noble one abandons those stages.

original: gtong ngo zhes 'byung bas rnam par nyams pa yang bshad la /
analyzed: gtong ngo zhes 'byung bas rnam par nyams pa yang bshad la /
translated: Since this is stated, degeneration is also explained.üîΩAnd since it is stated,

original: dang po gnyis yongs nyams pas kyang //
analyzed: dang po gnyis yongs nyams pas kyang //
translated: The first two are also completely degenerated.

original: zhes 'byung bas yongs su nyams pa yang bshad de /
analyzed: zhes 'byung bas yongs su nyams pa yang bshad de /
translated: Complete degeneration is also explained.

original: de'i phyir 'di dag gi zhes bya ba ston to //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di dag gi zhes bya ba ston to //
translated: Therefore, it is shown that these two are degeneration and complete degeneration.

original: nyams pa gnyis zhes bya ba ni rnam par nyams pa dang yongs su nyams pa dag gi spyi'i ngo bo yongs su bzung bas gnyi ga smos pa yin no //
analyzed: nyams pa gnyis zhes bya ba ni rnam par nyams pa dang yongs su nyams pa dag gi spyi'i ngo bo yongs su bzung bas gnyi ga smos pa yin no //
translated: Degeneration and complete degeneration are both mentioned by taking the general nature of degeneration and complete degeneration.

original: yongs su nyams pa ni nyes pas byas pa yin gyi zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pas byas pa yin gyi zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: yongs su nyams pa ni nyes pas byas pa yin gyi zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pas byas pa yin gyi zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Deterioration is due to a fault, i.e., due to the defilements.

original: rnam par nyams pa ni gdon mi za ba ma yin no zhes bya ba de ni nyes pas byas pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi yon tan gyis byas pa yang yin no //
analyzed: rnam par nyams pa ni gdon mi za ba ma yin no zhes bya ba de ni nyes pas byas pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi yon tan gyis byas pa yang yin no //
translated: Deterioration is not necessarily due to a fault. It is also due to a quality.

original: de la yon tan gyis byas pa ni 'di lta ste mthong ba'i @173b lam skyes na so so'i skye bo nyid rnam par nyams pa lta bu'o //üîΩnyes pas byas pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la yon tan gyis byas pa ni 'di lta ste mthong ba'i @173b lam skyes na so so'i skye bo nyid rnam par nyams pa lta bu'o // nyes pas byas pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Deterioration due to a quality is, for example, the deterioration of the state of an ordinary person when the path of insight arises.

original: log par lta bas dge ba'i rtsa ba rnam par nyams pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: log par lta bas dge ba'i rtsa ba rnam par nyams pa lta bu'o //
translated: Deterioration due to a fault is, for example, the deterioration of the roots of good due to false view.

original: yang na nyid mtshams sbyor ba'i sems kyis chos kha cig rnam par nyams pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: yang na nyid mtshams sbyor ba'i sems kyis chos kha cig rnam par nyams pa lta bu'o //
translated: Or else, deterioration is, for example, the deterioration of certain factors due to the thought of conception.

original: de lta na yongs su nyams pa gang yin pa de ni rnam par nyams pa yang yin no //
analyzed: de lta na yongs su nyams pa gang yin pa de ni rnam par nyams pa yang yin no //
translated: Thus, that which is deterioration is also deterioration due to a fault.

original: rnam par nyams pa gang yin pa de ni gdon mi za bar yongs su nyams pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam par nyams pa gang yin pa de ni gdon mi za bar yongs su nyams pa ma yin te /
translated: Those who retrogress from the fruit of a perfected being are not necessarily those who retrogress from the fruit of nonreturner.

original: yongs su nyams pa ni yon tan gyi khyad par dag kho na las yongs su nyams pas so //üîΩmi skye ba'i chos nyid 'thob ste zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba la sogs pa de dag gi so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa 'thob ste zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yongs su nyams pa ni yon tan gyi khyad par dag kho na las yongs su nyams pas so // mi skye ba'i chos nyid 'thob ste zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba la sogs pa de dag gi so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa 'thob ste zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: For the latter retrogress only from the special qualities, not from the fruit.üîΩThey obtain the status of one who is incapable of retrogressing.üîΩThey obtain the status of one who is incapable of retrogressing in relation to the cessation that is a nonanalytical cessation of those destinies, etc.üîΩIn relation to those destinies, etc., they obtain the status of one who is incapable of retrogressing in relation to the cessation that is a nonanalytical cessation.

original: de dag ci rigs par te zhes bya ba ni mi skye ba'i chos nyid de de dag ni ji ltar 'os 'os su bzod pa chung ngu dang chen po'i tshe 'thob bo zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: de dag ci rigs par te zhes bya ba ni mi skye ba'i chos nyid de de dag ni ji ltar 'os 'os su bzod pa chung ngu dang chen po'i tshe 'thob bo zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: They obtain the status of one who is incapable of retrogressing in relation to those destinies, etc.,üîΩin accordance with their type.üîΩIn accordance with their type means that they obtain the status of one who is incapable of retrogressing in relation to those destinies, etc.,üîΩin accordance with their type, either at the time of the weak or the strong stage of receptivity.

original: ji ltar byas pas she na /üîΩbzod pa chung ngu'i tshe ni ngan song gi 'gro ba rnams kyi mi skye ba'i chos nyid 'thob bo //
analyzed: ji ltar byas pas she na / bzod pa chung ngu'i tshe ni ngan song gi 'gro ba rnams kyi mi skye ba'i chos nyid 'thob bo //
translated: How is it obtained?üîΩAt the time of the weak stage of receptivity, they obtain the status of one who is incapable of retrogressing in relation to the destinies of the lower realms.

original: chen po'i tshe ni sgo nga las skye ba dang / drod gsher las skye ba'i skye gnas dag gi'o //
analyzed: chen po'i tshe ni sgo nga las skye ba dang / drod gsher las skye ba'i skye gnas dag gi'o //
translated: At the time of the strong stage of receptivity, they obtain the status of one who is incapable of retrogressing in relation to the destinies of the egg and heat and moisture birth.

original: chung ngu'i tshe ni 'du shes med pa'i sems can dang / byang gi sgra mi snyan dang / tshangs pa chen por skye ba rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: chung ngu'i tshe ni 'du shes med pa'i sems can dang / byang gi sgra mi snyan dang / tshangs pa chen por skye ba rnams kyi'o //
translated: The small is that of sentient beings in the state of nondiscernment, humans of Uttarakuru, and those born in the great Brahma realm.

original: chen po'i tshe ni zam dang ma ning dang mtshan gnyis pa'i lus rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: chen po'i tshe ni zam dang ma ning dang mtshan gnyis pa'i lus rnams kyi'o //
translated: The medium is that of eunuchs, neuters, and hermaphrodites.

original: chen po nyid kyi tshe ni srid pa brgyad pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: chen po nyid kyi tshe ni srid pa brgyad pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The great is that of the eighth existence and so on.

original: srid pa brgyad pa la sogs pa dang / dgu pa la sogs pa dang / mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i mi skye ba'i chos nyid 'thob bo //
analyzed: srid pa brgyad pa la sogs pa dang / dgu pa la sogs pa dang / mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i mi skye ba'i chos nyid 'thob bo //
translated: The eighth existence and so on obtain the state of nonarising that is to be abandoned by the path of seeing.

original: rigs de nyid ces bya ba ni slob dpon gyi gzhung lugs yin te /üîΩbzod pas yongs su bsgos pa'i nyan thos kyi rigs te /
analyzed: rigs de nyid ces bya ba ni slob dpon gyi gzhung lugs yin te / bzod pas yongs su bsgos pa'i nyan thos kyi rigs te /
translated: The lineage itself is the master's system.üîΩThe lineage of sravakas fully imbued with acceptance

original: de ni bzod pas yongs su bsgos pa nyid kyis bzlog tu mi rung ba'i phyir ro snyam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: de ni bzod pas yongs su bsgos pa nyid kyis bzlog tu mi rung ba'i phyir ro snyam du bsams pa'o //
translated: is irreversible because it is fully imbued with acceptance.

original: gzhan gsum yang zhes bya ba ni rang sangs rgyas su ni nyan thos kyi rigs las bzod pa yang bzlog nas 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan gsum yang zhes bya ba ni rang sangs rgyas su ni nyan thos kyi rigs las bzod pa yang bzlog nas 'gyur te /
translated: The other three also turn back from the stage of acceptance, but not from the stage of the path of seeing.

original: de dag ni gzhan gyi don du ngan song du mi 'gro ba'i phyir ro snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni gzhan gyi don du ngan song du mi 'gro ba'i phyir ro snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: They do not go to lower rebirths for the sake of others.

original: ting nge 'dzin mi g-yo ba dang / gsal ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni skyon brgyad las grol ba'i phyir ting nge 'dzin mi g-yo ba yin no //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin mi g-yo ba dang / gsal ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni skyon brgyad las grol ba'i phyir ting nge 'dzin mi g-yo ba yin no //
translated: Because concentration is unshakable and clear, it is unshakable because it is free from the eight flaws.

original: de nyid kyi phyir ram dbang po rnon po'i phyir gsal zhing sbyangs pa yin no //üîΩgang dag gi ltar na @174a * //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir ram dbang po rnon po'i phyir gsal zhing sbyangs pa yin no // gang dag gi ltar na @174a * //
translated: It is clear and purified because it is either that or it is of sharp faculty.üîΩThose who assert that there are pratyekabuddhas other than rhinoceros-like pratyekabuddhas.

original: bse ru lta bu las gzhan pa'i rang sangs rgyas yod par 'dod pa zhes bya ba ni chos mngon pa pa gang dag gi gzhung lugs kyis bse ru lta bu las gzhan pa'i rang sangs rgyas kyang yod par 'dod pa ste /
analyzed: bse ru lta bu las gzhan pa'i rang sangs rgyas yod par 'dod pa zhes bya ba ni chos mngon pa pa gang dag gi gzhung lugs kyis bse ru lta bu las gzhan pa'i rang sangs rgyas kyang yod par 'dod pa ste /
translated: This refers to those who assert that there are pratyekabuddhas other than rhinoceros-like pratyekabuddhas in accordance with the scriptures of the Abhidharma.

original: nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa tsam bskyed pa tshogs shing spyod pa'i rang sangs rgyas so snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa tsam bskyed pa tshogs shing spyod pa'i rang sangs rgyas so snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: The Rhinoceros-like One is the Solitary Realizer who generates only the aids to penetration and then, having completed the collections, becomes enlightened.

original: de dag gi ltar na de'i rigs dro bar gyur pa dang / rtse mo rnams ni zlog par dgag pa med de /
analyzed: de dag gi ltar na de'i rigs dro bar gyur pa dang / rtse mo rnams ni zlog par dgag pa med de /
translated: According to them, it is not refuted that the heat and peak of that type can be reversed.

original: bse ru lta bu kho na dmigs kyis bkar ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bse ru lta bu kho na dmigs kyis bkar ba'i phyir ro //
translated: But the Rhinoceros-like One is specified because he is the only one who can reverse the summit.

original: myur ba srid pa gsum gyis thar //
analyzed: myur ba srid pa gsum gyis thar //
translated: The Swift One is liberated in three existences.

original: zhes bya ba ni gang zhig thar pa myur bar thob pa de tshe gcig la ni thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba skyed par byed do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gang zhig thar pa myur bar thob pa de tshe gcig la ni thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba skyed par byed do //
translated: The one who attains liberation quickly generates the roots of virtue that are aids to penetration in one lifetime.

original: gnyis pa la ni nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa rnams so //
analyzed: gnyis pa la ni nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa rnams so //
translated: In the second, he generates the factors conducive to penetrations.

original: gsum pa la ni 'phags pa'i lam mo //
analyzed: gsum pa la ni 'phags pa'i lam mo //
translated: In the third, he generates the ƒÅrya path.

original: gang zhig tshe snga ma la thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i tshogs bsags pa de ni tshe gcig kho na la yang nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa rnams dang / 'phags pa'i lam skyed par byed do zhes bya bar khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: gang zhig tshe snga ma la thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i tshogs bsags pa de ni tshe gcig kho na la yang nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa rnams dang / 'phags pa'i lam skyed par byed do zhes bya bar khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: One who has accumulated the collection conducive to liberation in a previous life will definitely generate the factors conducive to penetrative insight and the arya path in just one lifetime.

original: sa bon 'debs pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ba ni sa bon 'debs pa lta bu'i thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa skye ba yin no //
analyzed: sa bon 'debs pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ba ni sa bon 'debs pa lta bu'i thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa skye ba yin no //
translated: The passage beginning ‚Äúlike planting seeds‚Äù indicates the arising of the factors conducive to liberation.

original: 'bru skye ba lta bu ni nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa skye ba yin no //
analyzed: 'bru skye ba lta bu ni nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa skye ba yin no //
translated: Like the arising of grain is the arising of the factors conducive to penetrative insight.

original: 'bras bu chags pa lta bu ni 'phags pa'i lam yin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu chags pa lta bu ni 'phags pa'i lam yin no //
translated: Like the ripening of the fruit is the arya path.

original: chos nyid 'di la zhes bya ba ni gsung rab kyi chos nyid la'o //üîΩ'jug pa dang yongs su smin pa dang rnam par grol bar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni don gyi dngos yin te /
analyzed: chos nyid 'di la zhes bya ba ni gsung rab kyi chos nyid la'o // 'jug pa dang yongs su smin pa dang rnam par grol bar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni don gyi dngos yin te /
translated: In this reality of Dharma refers to the reality of the scriptures.üîΩIt says that one enters, matures and is liberated refers to the actual meaning.

original: 'jug pa ni thar pa'i cha dang mthun pas so //
analyzed: 'jug pa ni thar pa'i cha dang mthun pas so //
translated: One enters through the factors conducive to liberation.

original: yongs su smin pa ni nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa rnams kyis so //
analyzed: yongs su smin pa ni nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa rnams kyis so //
translated: Ripened means by the factors conducive to penetration.

original: rnam par grol ba ni 'phags pa'i lam gyis so //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba ni 'phags pa'i lam gyis so //
translated: Liberated means by the noble path.

original: de'i smon lam gyis yongs su bzung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni yid kyi smon lam gyis yongs su bzung ba'i phyir te /

analyzed: gsum pa la ma gzegs par bzhi pa la 'dzeg par bya'o zhes smra na de skad du ma smra shig ces brjod par bya'o //
translated: He should be told, ‚ÄòDon‚Äôt say that.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /üîΩbang rim bzhi pa'i them skas la bang rim tha ma la ma gzegs par bang rim gnyis pa la 'dzeg pa nas /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / bang rim bzhi pa'i them skas la bang rim tha ma la ma gzegs par bang rim gnyis pa la 'dzeg pa nas /
translated: Why is that?üîΩIt is impossible and there is no opportunity for someone to ascend from the first step of a four-stepped ladder to the second step without stepping on the first step,

original: de bzhin du gsum pa la ma gzegs par bzhi pa la 'dzeg pa'i bar 'di ni gnas med cing go skabs med do //
analyzed: de bzhin du gsum pa la ma gzegs par bzhi pa la 'dzeg pa'i bar 'di ni gnas med cing go skabs med do //
translated: and so on up to: it is impossible and there is no opportunity for someone to ascend from the third step to the fourth step without stepping on the third step.‚Äù

original: de bzhin du 'di la yang sdug bsngal gyi bden pa ma mthong bar kun 'byung ba'i bden pa mthong bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa 'di ni gnas med do zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'di la yang sdug bsngal gyi bden pa ma mthong bar kun 'byung ba'i bden pa mthong bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa 'di ni gnas med do zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ngo //
translated: So too, here, it is impossible that one would see the truth of origin without having seen the truth of suffering.

original: de bzhin du 'phags pa kun dga' bos gsol pa /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'phags pa kun dga' bos gsol pa /
translated: So too, the noble Ananda said:

original: btsun pa ci lags /
analyzed: btsun pa ci lags /
translated: ‚ÄúVenerable!

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi po mthar gyis mngon par rtogs sam /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi po mthar gyis mngon par rtogs sam /
translated: Are the four noble truths realized in sequence or in a single moment?‚Äù

original: 'on te mngon par rtogs pa gcig pa lags zhes bya ba la sogs pa mdo snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: 'on te mngon par rtogs pa gcig pa lags zhes bya ba la sogs pa mdo snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The rest is as in the previous sutra.

original: kun dga' bo dper na gang zhig 'di skad du bdag gis gdang bu bzhi pa'i skas la /
analyzed: kun dga' bo dper na gang zhig 'di skad du bdag gis gdang bu bzhi pa'i skas la /
translated: Ananda, suppose someone said, ‚ÄúI will climb the four-runged ladder

original: gdang bu tha ma la rkang pas ma gzegs par gdang bu gnyis pa la 'dzeg go zhes bya ba nas de bzhin du gdang bu bzhi pa la rkang pas ma gzegs par khang bzangs kyi thog tu 'dzeg go zhes smra na de skad du ma smra zhig ces
analyzed: gdang bu tha ma la rkang pas ma gzegs par gdang bu gnyis pa la 'dzeg go zhes bya ba nas de bzhin du gdang bu bzhi pa la rkang pas ma gzegs par khang bzangs kyi thog tu 'dzeg go zhes smra na de skad du ma smra zhig ces
translated: without touching the first rung with my foot, and I will climb the second rung, and so on up to the fourth, without touching the fourth rung with my foot, and I will climb to the top of the palace.‚Äù

original: brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgyas par snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgyas par snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The rest is as before.

original: kun dga' bo gang zhig 'di skad du bdag gis sdug bsngal 'phags pa'i bden pa mngon par ma rtogs par kun 'byung ba'i bden pa mngon par rtogs par bya'o zhes bya ba nas rgyas par 'di ni gnas med de zhes bya ba'i bar snga ma bzhin te /
analyzed: kun dga' bo gang zhig 'di skad du bdag gis sdug bsngal 'phags pa'i bden pa mngon par ma rtogs par kun 'byung ba'i bden pa mngon par rtogs par bya'o zhes bya ba nas rgyas par 'di ni gnas med de zhes bya ba'i bar snga ma bzhin te /
translated: ‚ÄúƒÄnanda, it is impossible that one who has not realized the truth of suffering would realize the truth of origin, and so on, up to it is impossible that one who has not realized the truth of the path would realize the truth of cessation.

original: mdo gsum ni 'di dag yin no //
analyzed: mdo gsum ni 'di dag yin no //
translated: These are the three sutras.

original: gang zhig sdug bsngal la zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni ci ste mdo las /
analyzed: gang zhig sdug bsngal la zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni ci ste mdo las /
translated: If you assert that there is a single realization because a sutra states:

original: gang zhig sdug bsngal la @178a * //
analyzed: gang zhig sdug bsngal la @178a * //
translated: One who is free of doubt and uncertainty with regard to suffering

original: nem nur med cing the tshom med pa de ni sangs rgyas la yang zhes gsungs pas mngon par rtogs pa gcig go zhes bya bar 'dod na'o //
analyzed: nem nur med cing the tshom med pa de ni sangs rgyas la yang zhes gsungs pas mngon par rtogs pa gcig go zhes bya bar 'dod na'o //
translated: is also free of doubt and uncertainty with regard to the Buddha.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: sangs rgyas ni mi slob pa'i chos rnams yin la /
analyzed: sangs rgyas ni mi slob pa'i chos rnams yin la /
translated: The Buddha is the dharmas of no more learning.

original: mi slob pa'i chos de dag kyang lam yin no //
analyzed: mi slob pa'i chos de dag kyang lam yin no //
translated: Those dharmas of no more learning are the path.

original: de lta bas na sdug bsngal mngon par rtogs pa'i phyir des lam yang mngon par rtogs pa yin te //
analyzed: de lta bas na sdug bsngal mngon par rtogs pa'i phyir des lam yang mngon par rtogs pa yin te //
translated: Therefore, because he realizes suffering, he also realizes the path.

original: 'di ltar sdug bsngal bzhin du sangs rgyas la yang nem nur med cing the tshom med pas so //
analyzed: 'di ltar sdug bsngal bzhin du sangs rgyas la yang nem nur med cing the tshom med pas so //
translated: Just as he has no doubt or uncertainty about suffering, he also has no doubt or uncertainty about the Buddha.

original: nem nur dang / the tshom zhes bya ba ni don tha dad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: nem nur dang / the tshom zhes bya ba ni don tha dad pa ma yin no //
translated: Doubt and uncertainty are not different things.

original: yang na nem nur ni nges par mi 'dod pa yin no //
analyzed: yang na nem nur ni nges par mi 'dod pa yin no //
translated: Or else, doubt is the unwillingness to accept a fact.

original: the tshom ni ji skad bshad pa'i mtshan nyid kyi yid gnyis yin no //
analyzed: the tshom ni ji skad bshad pa'i mtshan nyid kyi yid gnyis yin no //
translated: Uncertainty is the indecision that has the characteristics that have been explained.

original: ma yin te /üîΩkun du mi 'byung ba dang / gdon mi za bar spong ba las dgongs te /üîΩgsungs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni kun du mi 'byung ba dang / gdon mi za bar spong ba las dgongs te /
analyzed: ma yin te / kun du mi 'byung ba dang / gdon mi za bar spong ba las dgongs te / gsungs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni kun du mi 'byung ba dang / gdon mi za bar spong ba las dgongs te /
translated: No, it is not.üîΩIt is said that there is only one realization because the Buddha had in mind the nonoccurrence of doubt and the certainty of its abandonment.

original: gsungs pa'i phyir mdo las mngon par rtogs pa gcig pa'o zhes 'byung ngo zhes zer ba de ni de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: gsungs pa'i phyir mdo las mngon par rtogs pa gcig pa'o zhes 'byung ngo zhes zer ba de ni de lta ma yin te /
translated: It is not so, because the Buddha had in mind the nonoccurrence of doubt and the certainty of its abandonment when he said in the sutra that there is only one realization.

original: sdug bsngal mngon par rtogs na yang sangs rgyas kyi yul la the tshom za ba kun du mi 'byung ba dang gdon mi za bar spong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sdug bsngal mngon par rtogs na yang sangs rgyas kyi yul la the tshom za ba kun du mi 'byung ba dang gdon mi za bar spong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When one realizes suffering, doubt about the object of the Buddha does not arise and one will certainly abandon it.

original: de'i phyir gang zhig sdug bsngal la nem nur med cing the tshom med pa de ni sangs rgyas la yang zhes gsungs par dgongs pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir gang zhig sdug bsngal la nem nur med cing the tshom med pa de ni sangs rgyas la yang zhes gsungs par dgongs pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is intended that one who has no doubt and no uncertainty about suffering will also have no doubt about the Buddha.

original: de dag ni sa drug pa'o zhes sngar bshad zin to zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de dag ni sa drug pa'o zhes sngar bshad zin to zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It was previously explained that these are the six levels,

original: mi lcogs pa med pa dang khyad par bsam gtan sa ba'o zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi lcogs pa med pa dang khyad par bsam gtan sa ba'o zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is said that the uninterrupted and special meditative stabilizations are levels.üîΩBecause they are not capable of being obstructed

original: bar chad bya bar mi nus pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la bar chad bya bar nus pa ni bar chad do //
analyzed: bar chad bya bar mi nus pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la bar chad bya bar nus pa ni bar chad do //
translated: Obstruction is that which is capable of obstructing.

original: bar chad med pas na bar chad med pa'o //
analyzed: bar chad med pas na bar chad med pa'o //
translated: Because they are without obstruction, they are uninterrupted.

original: de dag gis nyon mongs pa'i thob pa rnam par gcod de de dag gi gnas skabs de ni ring ba yin par 'dod do //
analyzed: de dag gis nyon mongs pa'i thob pa rnam par gcod de de dag gi gnas skabs de ni ring ba yin par 'dod do //
translated: They eliminate the obtainment of affliction and that state is considered distant.

original: bar chad med pa'i lam zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bar chad med pa'i lam zhes bya ba la /
translated: The uninterrupted path

original: bar chad med pa ni bar chad med pa'i ngo bo 'am bar chad med pa'i lam mo //
analyzed: bar chad med pa ni bar chad med pa'i ngo bo 'am bar chad med pa'i lam mo //
translated: The uninterrupted path is the uninterrupted path itself or it is the entity of the uninterrupted path.

original: de'i lam ni bar chad med pa'i lam mo //
analyzed: de'i lam ni bar chad med pa'i lam mo //
translated: The path of that is the uninterrupted path.

original: rnam par grol ba'i lam zhes bya ba ni rnam par grol ba'i lam ni rnam par grol ba'i lam ste /
analyzed: rnam par grol ba'i lam zhes bya ba ni rnam par grol ba'i lam ni rnam par grol ba'i lam ste /
translated: The path of liberation is the path of liberation.

original: nyon mongs pa las rnam par grol ba'i gnas skabs kyi lam mo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa las rnam par grol ba'i gnas skabs kyi lam mo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is the path in the state of liberation from affliction.üîΩIt is like two people expelling a thief and closing the door.

original: gnyis kyis rkun po 'byin pa dang / sgo gcod pa bzhin no zhes bya ba ni dper na gnyis las gcig gis ni rkun po @178b phyir 'byin par byed la /
analyzed: gnyis kyis rkun po 'byin pa dang / sgo gcod pa bzhin no zhes bya ba ni dper na gnyis las gcig gis ni rkun po @178b phyir 'byin par byed la /
translated: For example, one of two people expels a thief.

original: gnyis pas ni de nang du mi shor bar bya ba'i phyir sgo gcod pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: gnyis pas ni de nang du mi shor bar bya ba'i phyir sgo gcod pa de bzhin du /
translated: The second closes the door to prevent the thief from reentering.

original: bar chad med pa'i lam gyis ni nyon mongs pa'i chom rkun de'i thob pa gcod pa'i sgo nas 'byin par byed la /
analyzed: bar chad med pa'i lam gyis ni nyon mongs pa'i chom rkun de'i thob pa gcod pa'i sgo nas 'byin par byed la /
translated: In the same way, the uninterrupted path expels the thief of affliction by eliminating its obtainment.

original: rnam par grol ba'i lam gyis ni bral ba'i thob pa da ltar du byed pa'i sgo nas sgo gcod par byed do //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba'i lam gyis ni bral ba'i thob pa da ltar du byed pa'i sgo nas sgo gcod par byed do //
translated: The liberated path blocks the door by means of generating the obtainment of separation in the present.

original: gal te zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni gal te bar chad med pa'i lam gnyis pa sdug bsngal ba la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa kho na bral ba'i thob pa lhan cig spyi'i sdug bsngal la chos shes pa ni mi skye ba kho na ste
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni gal te bar chad med pa'i lam gnyis pa sdug bsngal ba la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa kho na bral ba'i thob pa lhan cig spyi'i sdug bsngal la chos shes pa ni mi skye ba kho na ste
translated: If, as extensively explained, if the second uninterrupted path, the perseverance for subsequent knowledge of the truth of suffering alone generates the obtainment of separation, then the Dharma knowledge of the truth of suffering would not arise.

original: / 'dis bya dgos pa gang yin pa de ni sdug bsngal la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa kho nas byed par 'gyur na zhes bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: / 'dis bya dgos pa gang yin pa de ni sdug bsngal la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa kho nas byed par 'gyur na zhes bsams pa yin no //
translated: The thought is that whatever is to be done by this perseverance for subsequent knowledge of the truth of suffering alone would be done.üîΩKnowledge that abandons doubt in that focal object does not arise.

original: dmigs pa de kho na la the tshom spangs pa'i shes pa zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sdug bsngal de kho na la the tshom spangs pa'i shes pa skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dmigs pa de kho na la the tshom spangs pa'i shes pa zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sdug bsngal de kho na la the tshom spangs pa'i shes pa skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Knowledge that abandons doubt in that focal object does not arise.

original: sdug bsngal de la chos shes pa'i bzod pa ni the tshom dang bcas pa kho nar 'jug ste /üîΩthe tshom ma spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sdug bsngal de la chos shes pa'i bzod pa ni the tshom dang bcas pa kho nar 'jug ste / the tshom ma spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Patience for knowing the truth of suffering is definitely concomitant with doubt because doubt has not been abandoned.

original: sdug bsngal de la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa the tshom spangs pa yin no zhes bya bar rnam par gzhag par yang mi nus te de'i yul ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sdug bsngal de la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa the tshom spangs pa yin no zhes bya bar rnam par gzhag par yang mi nus te de'i yul ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not possible to posit that patience for subsequent knowledge of the truth of suffering abandons doubt because it is not the object of that patience.üîΩIf you say that the treatise that declares that the nine types of fetters are abandoned by the path of seeing is not definitive, then it is not tenable that the nine types of fetters are abandoned by the path of seeing.

original: gal te bzod pa rnams kyis zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni gal te bzod pa rnams kyis nyon mongs pa spong ba'i phyir bstan bcos la kun du sbyor ba'i ris dgu ste /
analyzed: gal te bzod pa rnams kyis zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni gal te bzod pa rnams kyis nyon mongs pa spong ba'i phyir bstan bcos la kun du sbyor ba'i ris dgu ste /
translated: If you say that the treatise that declares that the nine types of fetters are abandoned by the path of seeing is not definitive, then it is not tenable that the nine types of fetters are abandoned by the path of seeing.

original: sdug bsngal la chos shes pas spang bar bya ba'i kun du sbyor ba'i ris dang / kun 'byung ba la chos shes pas spang bar bya ba dang / 'gog pa la chos shes pas spang bar bya ba dang / lam la chos shes pas spang bar bya ba dang sdug bsngal la rjes su shes pas spang bar bya ba dang /
analyzed: sdug bsngal la chos shes pas spang bar bya ba'i kun du sbyor ba'i ris dang / kun 'byung ba la chos shes pas spang bar bya ba dang / 'gog pa la chos shes pas spang bar bya ba dang / lam la chos shes pas spang bar bya ba dang sdug bsngal la rjes su shes pas spang bar bya ba dang /
translated: The class of fetters abandoned by Dharma knowledge of the truth of suffering, the class of fetters abandoned by Dharma knowledge of the truth of origin, the class of fetters abandoned by Dharma knowledge of the truth of cessation, the class of fetters abandoned by Dharma knowledge of the truth of path, the class of fetters abandoned by subsequent knowledge of the truth of suffering,

original: kun 'byung ba la rjes su shes pas spang bar bya ba dang / 'gog pa la rjes su shes pas spang bar bya ba dang / lam la rjes su shes pas spang bar bya ba dang / bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i kun du sbyor ba'i ris so zhes 'byung ba dang /
analyzed: kun 'byung ba la rjes su shes pas spang bar bya ba dang / 'gog pa la rjes su shes pas spang bar bya ba dang / lam la rjes su shes pas spang bar bya ba dang / bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i kun du sbyor ba'i ris so zhes 'byung ba dang /
translated: the class of fetters abandoned by subsequent knowledge of the truth of origin, the class of fetters abandoned by subsequent knowledge of the truth of cessation, the class of fetters abandoned by subsequent knowledge of the truth of path and the class of fetters abandoned by the path of meditation.üîΩThis contradicts the sutra that states:

original: mdo las dge slong dag de lta na nyon mongs pa rnams ni shes pas gzhom par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: mdo las dge slong dag de lta na nyon mongs pa rnams ni shes pas gzhom par bya ba yin no //
translated: Monks, thus afflictions are to be conquered by knowledge.

original: sems ni glog lta bu'o zhes 'byung ba gang yin pa de dang yang 'gal te /
analyzed: sems ni glog lta bu'o zhes 'byung ba gang yin pa de dang yang 'gal te /
translated: The mind is like lightning.

original: de las ni bzod pas spang bar bya ba'i kun du sbyor ba'i ris ma bshad do zhe na ma yin te /üîΩbzod pa rnams ni zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /
analyzed: de las ni bzod pas spang bar bya ba'i kun du sbyor ba'i ris ma bshad do zhe na ma yin te / bzod pa rnams ni zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /
translated: But the class of fetters abandoned by the path of seeing is not explained.

original: @179a * // de ni de lta ma yin no //üîΩci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: @179a * // de ni de lta ma yin no // ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: That is not so,

original: bzod pa rnams ni shes pa'i 'khor yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: bzod pa rnams ni shes pa'i 'khor yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: because the forbearing ones are the retinue of the knowing ones.

original: bzod pa rnams ni shes pa'i 'khor yin no //
analyzed: bzod pa rnams ni shes pa'i 'khor yin no //
translated: The forbearing ones are the retinue of the knowing ones.

original: de'i phyir bzod pas spang bar bya ba'i kun du sbyor ba'i ris la shes pas spang bar bya ba zhes brjod de /
analyzed: de'i phyir bzod pas spang bar bya ba'i kun du sbyor ba'i ris la shes pas spang bar bya ba zhes brjod de /
translated: Therefore the class of fetters abandoned by the path of seeing is called that which is abandoned by the path of seeing.

original: rgyal pos byas so zhes tha snyad 'dogs pa bzhin no dper na rgyal po'i 'khor gyis byas pa'i don 'ga' zhig la rgyas pos byas so zhes tha snyad 'dogs pa de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: rgyal pos byas so zhes tha snyad 'dogs pa bzhin no dper na rgyal po'i 'khor gyis byas pa'i don 'ga' zhig la rgyas pos byas so zhes tha snyad 'dogs pa de dang 'dra'o //
translated: For example, in some matter created by the retinue of a king, the expression ‚Äúcreated by the king‚Äù is used.

original: bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i kun du sbyor ba'i ris ni shes pas spang bar bya ba kho na yin te /
analyzed: bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i kun du sbyor ba'i ris ni shes pas spang bar bya ba kho na yin te /
translated: The class of fetters abandoned by the path of meditation is that which is abandoned by the path of meditation alone.

original: de la ni bar chad med pa'i lam yang shes pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pas so //
analyzed: de la ni bar chad med pa'i lam yang shes pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pas so //
translated: The path of immediate succession is also by nature knowledge.

original: nyon mongs pa spang bar bya ba la ni bar chad med pa'i lam kho na khyad par du gtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa spang bar bya ba la ni bar chad med pa'i lam kho na khyad par du gtogs pa yin no //
translated: But the path of immediate succession is the only one that is specifically related to the abandonment of the defilements.

original: bden pa ma mthong ba mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba shes pa'i tshe ji ltar bden pa ma mthong ba mthong ba yin zhe na /üîΩde yang bden pa gzhan ma mthong ba'i tshe na yod pas mthong ba'i lam gyi bar na yod pa'i shes pa mthong ba'i lam yin te /
analyzed: bden pa ma mthong ba mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba shes pa'i tshe ji ltar bden pa ma mthong ba mthong ba yin zhe na / de yang bden pa gzhan ma mthong ba'i tshe na yod pas mthong ba'i lam gyi bar na yod pa'i shes pa mthong ba'i lam yin te /
translated: How can one say that one sees the truth that was not seen, when one knows that one does not see the truth?üîΩThe truth that was not seen is the truth that was not seen at the moment when one obtains the path of insight.

original: brgyud pa la bsams nas des kyang mthong ba mthong ba yin no //
analyzed: brgyud pa la bsams nas des kyang mthong ba mthong ba yin no //
translated: The knowledge that one does not see the truth is the knowledge that one does not see the other truths at the moment when one sees one truth.üîΩThis knowledge is included in the path of insight, for it is produced in the interval between two moments of the path of insight.

original: yang na ma mthong bas ma mthong ba mthong ba'i phyir skad cig ma bco lnga ni mthong ba'i lam yin te /
analyzed: yang na ma mthong bas ma mthong ba mthong ba'i phyir skad cig ma bco lnga ni mthong ba'i lam yin te /
translated: Or else, the fifteen moments are the path of insight, because one sees the non-vision of the truth.

original: ji srid du gang zag 'di'i ma mthong ba mthong ba 'jug pa de srid du 'di'i skad cig ma rnams mthong ba'i lam yin no //
analyzed: ji srid du gang zag 'di'i ma mthong ba mthong ba 'jug pa de srid du 'di'i skad cig ma rnams mthong ba'i lam yin no //
translated: As long as the non-vision of the truth is in the process of being seen, the moments in which this non-vision is seen are the path of insight.

original: 'dis sdug bsngal mthong yang 'di la kun 'byung ba la ma mthong ba mthong ba 'jug pa kho na'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis sdug bsngal mthong yang 'di la kun 'byung ba la ma mthong ba mthong ba 'jug pa kho na'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
translated: This is the path of seeing, but it is not the path of seeing of the origin of suffering, etc.

original: skad cig ma bcu drug pa ni bsgom pa'i lam kho na yin no zhes bya bar tshig khong nas drang ngo //
analyzed: skad cig ma bcu drug pa ni bsgom pa'i lam kho na yin no zhes bya bar tshig khong nas drang ngo //

analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi pa thob pa gang zhig sa drug las gang yang rung ba zhig la brten te nges par 'jug pa de ni sems bcu drug pa la phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu mi lcogs pa med pa'i sa pa nas bsam gtan bzhi pa'i sa pa'i bar

original: dgu pa tshun chad zad pa yin //
analyzed: dgu pa tshun chad zad pa yin //

original: 'dod pa'am yang na gong ma las //
analyzed: 'dod pa'am yang na gong ma las //

translated: For, he realizes all the streams through the perseverance for subsequent insight into the truth of the path, but the eighth does not.

original: de lta bas na rgyu de dag gis na 'bras bu thams cad 'thob pa kho na la rgyun du zhugs pa zhes bya'o /
analyzed: de lta bas na rgyu de dag gis na 'bras bu thams cad 'thob pa kho na la rgyun du zhugs pa zhes bya'o /
translated: Therefore, by these causes, he is called a stream-enterer because he obtains all the fruits.

original: brgyad pa la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: brgyad pa la ni ma yin no //
translated: But not the eighth.

original: mchog tu gyur pa'i phyir de skad ces brjod de /
analyzed: mchog tu gyur pa'i phyir de skad ces brjod de /
translated: It is so called because it is the best.

original: dper na 'jig rten na yang gang zhig mchog tu gsal bar byed pa de la nyi ma zhes bya'o /
analyzed: dper na 'jig rten na yang gang zhig mchog tu gsal bar byed pa de la nyi ma zhes bya'o /
translated: For example, in the world, that which illuminates supremely is called the sun,üîΩnot a firefly.

original: srin bu me khyer la ni ma yin pa de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: srin bu me khyer la ni ma yin pa de dang 'dra'o //
translated: It is like that.

original: de las gzhan pa zhes bya ba ni de'i tshe srid pa de las gzhan pa'o //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa zhes bya ba ni de'i tshe srid pa de las gzhan pa'o //
translated: Other than that means other than that existence at that time.üîΩLike the one skilled in the seven subjects and the one with seven leaves.

original: gnas bdun la mkhas pa zhes @184b bya ba dang / 'dab ma bdun pa zhes bya ba bzhin no zhes bya ba ni dper na bdun tshan du mthun pa'i phyir mdo las dge slong gnas bdun la mkhas pa zhes bshad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: gnas bdun la mkhas pa zhes @184b bya ba dang / 'dab ma bdun pa zhes bya ba bzhin no zhes bya ba ni dper na bdun tshan du mthun pa'i phyir mdo las dge slong gnas bdun la mkhas pa zhes bshad pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, because they are in groups of seven, the s≈´tra explains that a monk is skilled in the seven subjects.üîΩHow is that?

original: ji lta zhe na rgyas par bshad nas bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na rgyas par bshad nas bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Buddha explained in detail:

original: dge slong dag ji ltar na dge slong gnas bdun la mkhas pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: dge slong dag ji ltar na dge slong gnas bdun la mkhas pa yin zhe na /
translated: Monks, how is a monk skilled in the seven subjects?

original: gzugs yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu shes so //
analyzed: gzugs yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu shes so //
translated: He knows form as it truly is.

original: gzugs kun 'byung ba dang / gzugs 'gog pa dang / gzugs 'gog par 'gro ba'i lam dang / gzugs kyi ro myang ba dang / gzugs kyi nyes dmigs dang / nges par 'byung ba yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu shes so //
analyzed: gzugs kun 'byung ba dang / gzugs 'gog pa dang / gzugs 'gog par 'gro ba'i lam dang / gzugs kyi ro myang ba dang / gzugs kyi nyes dmigs dang / nges par 'byung ba yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu shes so //
translated: the disadvantages of form,üîΩand the escape from form.

original: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu shes so zhes bya ba nas rnam par shes pa kun 'byung ba zhes bya ba rgyas par nges par 'byung ba yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu shes so zhes bya ba'i bar du
analyzed: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu shes so zhes bya ba nas rnam par shes pa kun 'byung ba zhes bya ba rgyas par nges par 'byung ba yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu shes so zhes bya ba'i bar du
translated: Similarly, he knows feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness as they really are, up to he knows the origination of consciousness as it really is, up to he knows the escape from consciousness as it really is.

original: 'byung ngo // de ltar na tshul 'dis bdun tshan lnga ni sum cu rtsa lnga yin pas sum cu rtsa lnga la mkhas pa yin no //
analyzed: 'byung ngo // de ltar na tshul 'dis bdun tshan lnga ni sum cu rtsa lnga yin pas sum cu rtsa lnga la mkhas pa yin no //
translated: Thus, by this method, there are five groups of seven, making thirty-five, and thus he is skilled in the thirty-five.

original: lo ma bdun pa zhes bya ba dang yang 'dra ste /
analyzed: lo ma bdun pa zhes bya ba dang yang 'dra ste /
translated: It is similar to the seven-leaved plant.

original: dper na lo ma re re la 'dab ma bdun yod par 'dra ba'i phyir /
analyzed: dper na lo ma re re la 'dab ma bdun yod par 'dra ba'i phyir /
translated: For example, they are similar in that each leaf has seven petals.
